title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 August 8, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: A2 | Section: News 
 
 149
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Nellie is a 10-year-old female tortoiseshell Manx mix. She is quiet and independent.She likes to be in the same room as her people and get petted, but she is not a lap cat.She wants affection on her terms and space when she isn't in the mood - don't we all?.Because of her Manx genes, Nellie has a cute little stub tail, but unfortunately has Manx syndrome and does not always use the litter box. It isn't her fault though, she just can't always tell when she has to go potty.Nellie does fine with other cats, but we do not recommend a home with children since she isn't afraid to give someone a little smack if they don't respect her space. Can you give Queen Nellie the purrfect home? Fill out an adoption application on Chesapeake Cats and Dogs website, chesapeakecatsanddogs.org. Call 410-643-9955 for an appointment to meet this cat.

llm_classification.explanation: The article is a pet adoption notice published in a local newspaper's 'News' section, matching 'Public Notices' as it serves as a community announcement. While 'Local Life' could be considered for its community focus, the primary nature of the content as a formal notice makes 'Public Notices' the best fit.

title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 August 9, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: 19 | Section: News 
 
 112
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Caption: CAROLINE HUMANE SOCIETY
 
Let's find Jake his new home. Jake has been waiting since March. This adorable boy is a Jack Russell mix, about 30 pounds. Even though he is 9-years-old you would never know it. He has lots of play in him but also loves to just spend time chilling too. He would be the perfect companion for someone looking for a medium-size dog they can take everywhere. Jake knows lots of commands and is great on a leash. We do suggest no cats for Jake though; he likes them a little too much. For more information call the Caroline Humane Society at 410-822-1600 or email info@carolinehumane.org. The shelter is open Tuesday to Saturday.

'Local Life' is a secondary fit due to its community-focused nature, but the primary classification is 'Public Notices' as it directly matches the content type.

Joppa Rd Hampton Plaza-Suite 1103 Baltimore, MD 21286 www.hwestauctions.com 410-769-9797 3027398 TR 8/2,8/9,8/16/2023 McCabe, Weisberg & Conway, LLC 312 Marshall Avenue, Suite 800 Laurel, MD 20707 www.mwc-law.com SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEES' SALE OF IMPROVED REAL PROPERTY 14595 FOX CHASE CIR.RIDGELY, MD 21660 Under a power of sale contained in a certain Deed of Trust from Monique Herzberger and Jeffrey Thomas Figiel, dated October 9, 2003 and recorded in Liber 550, folio 946 among the Land Records of Caroline County, MD, default having occurred under the terms thereof and at the request of the parties secured thereby, the undersigned Substitute Trustees will offer for sale at public auction at the Circuit Court for Caroline County, at the Court House Door, 109 Market St., Denton, MD 21629, on AUGUST 29, 2023 AT 10:55 AM ALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND AND THE IMPROVEMENTS THEREON situated in Caroline County, Maryland and more fully described in the aforesaid Deed of Trust. The property is improved by a dwelling.The property, will be sold in an "as is" condition and subject to conditions, restrictions, easements, encumbrances and agreements of record affecting the subject property, if any, and with no warranty of any kind.Terms of Sale: A deposit in the form of cashier's or certified check, or in such other form as the Substitute Trustees may determine, at their sole discretion, for $5,000 at the time of sale. If the noteholder and/or servicer is the successful bidder, the deposit requirement is waived. Balance of the purchase price is to be paid within ten (10) days of the final ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Caroline County, Maryland. Interest is to be paid on the unpaid purchase price at the rate of 5% per annum from date of sale to the date the funds are received in the office of the Substitute Trustees, if the property is purchased by an entity other than the noteholder and/or servicer. If payment of the balance does not occur within ten (10) days of ratification, the deposit will be forfeited as liquidated damages. The purchaser agrees that the property may be resold pursuant to an order of court, waives personal service upon themselves and/or any principal or corporate designee of any documents filed regarding the failure to pay the purchase price within ten (10) days of ratification and expressly agrees to accept service by first class mail of said documents at the address provided by the purchaser in the Memorandum of Sale. The purchaser will not be entitled to any surplus or profits arising from the resale even if they are the result of improvements made by the purchaser. There will be no abatement of interest due from the purchaser in the event settlement is delayed for any reason. Taxes, ground rent, water rent, and all other public charges and assessments payable on an annual basis, including sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges, and front foot benefit charges, if applicable, to be adjusted for the current year to the date of sale, and assumed thereafter by the purchaser. Condominium fees and/or homeowners association dues, if any, shall be assumed by the purchaser from the date of sale. The purchaser shall be responsible for the payment of the ground rent escrow, if required. Cost of all documentary stamps, transfer taxes (including agricultural transfer taxes, if applicable), and all settlement charges shall be borne by the purchaser. The sale is subject to a post sale audit of the loan, including but not limited to an analysis of whether the borrower entered into a loan modification agreement, filed bankruptcy, reinstated or paid off the loan prior to the sale. The Substitute Trustees will convey either insurable or marketable title. If the Substitute Trustees are unable to convey insurable or marketable title or, the post sale audit concludes that the sale should not have occurred, or the sale is not ratified by the court for any reason, the purchaser's sole remedy in law or equity shall be limited to the refund of the deposit without interest even if the purchaser has made improvements to the property. Upon refund of the deposit, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Substitute Trustees. Purchaser shall be responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property. The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the property immediately after the sale. (Matter #18-602836).Laura H. G. Pumping during periods of maximum use may lower the water table less than 3.6 feet at a distance of 910 feet (estimated nearest user). Changes in water levels decrease over greater distances. Joppa Rd Hampton Plaza-Suite 1103 Baltimore, MD 21286 www.hwestauctions.com 410-769-9797 3027270 TR 7/26,8/2,8/9/2023Notice of Federalsburg Town Election, Filing By Candidates, and Notice to Voters Notice is hereby given that there will be an election in the Town of Federalsburg on: Tuesday, September 26, 2023 Between the hours of 7 a.m. and 7 p.m. for the purpose of electing one Mayor and four Councilpersons. All persons desiring to become a candidate for Mayor must have resided in the Town for at least one (1) year prior to the election. Candidates for District 1 Councilmember and candidates for District 2 Councilmember must have resided in the legislative district in which they are seeking election for at least one (1) year prior to the election. All candidates must be registered voters in the Town of Federalsburg. All qualified persons who wish to become a candidate for Mayor or Councilperson shall file with the Town Clerk a written statement of candidacy, accompanied by a petition signed by at least ten (10) duly qualified voters nominating such candidate in the form prescribed by the Federalsburg Town Charter, Article II, titled "Elections", Section C2-1. Candidates for Councilperson shall have a petition signed by at least ten (10) duly qualified voters that reside within the legislative district in which they are seeking election.In addition, the Maryland Public Ethics Law and Section 65-4 of the Federalsburg Town Code require that candidates filing for Mayor and Council file a financial disclosure statement, which must be filed with the certificate of candidacy. The written statement of candidacy, petition form, and financial disclosure statement are available upon request at the Town Office.The written statement of candidacy, petition for filing, and financial disclosure statement must be delivered to the Town Office, 118 North Main Street, Federalsburg, Maryland, by 12:00 P.M. on Friday, September 1, 2023. It is recommended that candidates file their statement of candidacy and petition no later than 4:00 p.m. on Thursday, August 31, 2023, so that additional signatures may be obtained before the filing deadline, in the event that the signatories to the petition are not duly qualified voters of the Town.Voter Qualifications: To vote in the election, you must: (1) be a resident of the Town of Federalsburg for thirty (30) consecutive days, preceding Tuesday, September 26, 2023, and (2) be eighteen (18) years of age by Tuesday, September 26, 2023.The last day for Voter Registration is Monday, September 18, 2023. llm_classification.explanation: The article consists entirely of legal and public notices related to court proceedings, estate settlements, property sales, and government announcements. While 'Public Notices' is explicitly listed, other categories like 'Local Government' or 'Legal Notices' are subsets of this broader category. The content matches 'Public Notices' most directly as it includes official notifications required by law.

Whitehill, Project Administrator - (c) 443-988-1947 or by e-mail - michael@whitehillconsultingllc.com3030658 SD/DS 8/11/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICENotice is hereby given that Bill No. 1538, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE IMPROVEMENTS TO AND EXPANSION OF THE CHAPEL DISTRICT ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, was enacted by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, August 8, 2023The legislation will become effective as outlined in the legislation.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY3031048 SD 8/11/2023PUBLIC NOTICE TOWN OF HURLOCK CHARTER AMENDMENT RESOLUTION 2023-1 Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 will be on the agenda for consideration during the Town Meeting August 14, 2023. Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 will amend the way council terms are considered for the purpose of council salary. Currently council terms must be consecutive for the tiered council salary system. Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 will eliminate the need for council terms to be consecutive.A full copy of proposed Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 will be available from the town office at 311 Charles Street, Hurlock, MD 21643. This Resolution may be introduced and voted on during the same meeting.John H. Avery Town Manager3031041 SD 8/11/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICENotice is hereby given that Bill No. 1546, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR, AND POSSIBLE FUTURE CONSTRUCTION OF, A TALBOT COUNTY VISITORS CENTER, was enacted by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, August 8, 2023.The legislation will become effective as outlined in the legislation.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY3031046 SD 8/11/2023Public Hearing Town of SecretaryNotice is hereby given that a public hearing will be held by the Board of Appeals on Thursday, August 24, 2023 at 7:00 p.m. at Town Hall, 122 Main Street, Secretary, MD, on Appeal Case No.2023-8 filed by Greg Koski for a Variance of front and side yard setbacks at 120 Second St., Secretary, MD 21664. For further information please call the office at 410-943-3113.William J. Gullion, III Zoning Inspector3030477 SD/DS 8/11,8/18/2023PUBLIC AUCTION OF CONTENTS OF ABOX STORAGE UNIT OF JIM FREEMAN AUGUST 24, 2023 AT 12:00 P.M.ABOX LLC3063 BEVERLY LANE CAMBRIDGE, MARYLAND 21613 FOXWELLS AUCTION3029314 SD 8/4,8/11/2023PUBLIC NOTICE - STATE OF MARYLAND DRAFT 2022 Consolidated Plan Annual Performance and Evaluation Report (CAPER) and Amendment to the Recovery Housing ProgramNotice is hereby given that the State of Maryland has opened a 30-day public comment period on the Draft 2020 Consolidated Plan Annual Performance and Evaluation Report (CAPER). In addition, notification is also given of an amendment to the Recovery Housing Program.The Consolidated Plan is a planning document required by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) and is prepared by the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD). It covers a five-year period and is designed to coordinate Federal, and to a lesser extent State, resources to provide decent housing, economic opportunities, and an acceptable living environment for Maryland's citizens. The Plan is updated every year during the five-year period through an Annual Action Plan and includes a series of one year goals toward meeting the overall five year goals of the Plan.Maryland's Consolidated Plan covers the State's non-entitlement jurisdictions. Entitlement jurisdictions - those that receive funding directly from HUD, including Anne Arundel, Baltimore, Harford, Howard, Montgomery and Prince George's Counties, and the Cities of Annapolis, Baltimore, Bowie, Cumberland, Frederick, Gaithersburg, Hagerstown, and Salisbury - prepare their own Consolidated Plans and are not covered by the State plan.As part of the Consolidated Planning process, the State submits a CAPER to HUD which describes the progress the State has made in carrying out the one-year goals contained in the five-year Plan.DHCD has completed the third year of the five-year Plan that ended June 30, 2023, and the draft CAPER details the progress DHCD made toward it housing and community development goals in the last year.DHCD is interested in public input and comment on the draft CAPER available on our website@https://dhcd.maryland.gov/Pages/ConsolidatedPlan.aspx. We will take written comments (via email) on the report through COB Monday, September 18, 2023. In addition, we will hold four in-person hearings at the locations listed below and one virtual hearing: First Hearing:Monday, August 14 · 11:30 am - 12:30 pmOwings - Calvert Library Fairview Branch8120 Southern Maryland BlvdOwings, MD 20736Second Hearing:Tuesday, August 15 · 11:00 am - 12:00 pmTowson - Baltimore County Public Library320 York RoadTowson, MD 21204Third Hearing: Friday, August 18 · 11:00 am - 12:00 pmCaroline - Caroline Public Library Federalsburg Location123 Morris AveFederalsburg, MD 21632Fourth Hearing: Monday, August 28 · 11:00 am - 12:00 pmCumberland - Allegany County Department of Economic and Community Development701 Kelly RoadCumberland, MD 21502Fifth Hearing: Wednesday, August 30th · 6:00 pm - 7:00 pmTime zone: America/New YorkVideo call link: https://meet.google.com/biq-jxor-ifeOr dial: (US) +1 575-518-3167 PIN: 151 751 081#2023 Action Plan Amendment - Recovery Housing ProgramThe State of Maryland has been awarded a fourth year of funding in the amount of $1,295,266 from the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development for the Recovery Housing Program (RHP). A substantial amendment to the FY 2023 Annual Action Plan is necessary in order to receive the fourth round of RHP funds. For this grant, like the previous three awards, the State is proposing to use the funds through a competitive process to county governments who can apply for themselves or on behalf of eligible non-profit providers to provide recovery housing for women and children.The Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development hereby gives notice that the substantial amendment to the FY 2023 Action Plan, as well as revisions to the three previous RHP amendments, will be available for public review and comment from August 14 through September 12, 2023. Upon conclusion of the comment period on September 12th, any responses received will be considered and the plan will be finalized and submitted to HUD.There will be two public hearings during the comment period to discuss the proposed plan. The public hearings will be held: Tuesday, August 15, 2023 at 6:00 pm - Virtual Join by phone: 631-898-6319 PIN# 781 111 935# Wednesday, August 23, 2023 at 10:00 am - In Person 7800 Harkins Road, Lanham The draft RHP Action Plan can be found at under the Consolidated Plan@hhtps://dhcd.maryland.gov/Pages/Publications.aspx.Contact Cindy Stone at 301-429-7519 or cindy.stone@maryland.gov with any questions.The State will make every effort to accommodate those with disabilities by providing the meetings in both audio and visual format. Persons requiring a translator should request one at least three days prior to the virtual hearing they plan to attend. Any questions or comments should also be directed to the address or e-mail listed below: Bernice Mensah Director, Housing Economic Research Office Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development 7800 Harkins Road Lanham, Maryland 20706 (301) 729-7446 Maryland Relay for the Deaf at 1 (800) 735-2258 bernice.mensah@maryland.gov3030957 SD 8/11/2023STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA) IN THE COURT OF COMMON PLEAS) 4TH JUDICAL CIRCUIT COUNTY OF DARLINGTON) CASE NO. 2023-CP-16-00077 BRITTANY HINES, PLAINTIFF vs. PAISLEE ANNE DAVIS, DEFENDANT A DAMAGES HEARING HAS BEEN SET in the above-entitled action on MONDAY, August 28, 2023, at 10:00 AM. You are hereby notified to contact the Darlington County Clerk of Court on or prior to this date.Florence, SC The Law Office of Linward C. Edwards II August 2,2023 Linward C. Edwards, Attorney for Plaintiff 821 West Evans Street Florence, SC 29501 (843) 410-96053030616 SD/DS 8/11,8/18,8/25/2023City of Cambridge DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS PLANNING & ZONING 1025 Washington St.Cambridge, Maryland 21613 Telephone: 410-228-1955 Fax: 410-228-3814 HPC Agenda The City of Cambridge Historic Preservation Commission will conduct an in-person meeting on Wednesday, August 16th, 2023 at 6:00 p.m at Council Chambers, 305 Gay Street.The meeting will be streamed live on TownHallStreams.com The conference call-in instructions are: Dial in: (848)-777-1500# Access code: 83256# Items on the agenda are: Administratively Approved 1. AA 2024 - 1 206 Willis: Shed roof shingle replacement.2. AA 2024 - 2 601 Church: Primary roof shingle replacement.3. AA 2024 - 3 1109 Locust: Primary roof repair and replacement.HPC Review: 4. HPC 2023 - 80 103 Belvedere: Screened porch to all weather porch 5. HPC 2024 - 13 203 Oakley: Window Replacement 6. HPC 2024 - 14 119 Willis: Rear yard improvements 7. HPC 2024 - 15 1001 Locust: New fence and shed 8. HPC 2024 - 16 206 Oakley: Front stair handrail installation 9. HPC 2024 - 17 313 Willis: New shed 10. HPC 2024 - 18 116 Belvedere: New Deck Discussion Items 11. Hearn Building Concept Plan 12. Portion of parking lot at 530 Poplar within the Historic District This agenda is subject to change, the final agenda will be approved by the Commission at the Hearing.3031051 SD 8/11/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC HEARING NOTICENotice is hereby given that the County Council of Talbot County, Maryland will conduct a public hearing to obtain the views of citizens on community, economic development and housing needs to be considered for submission of an application to the Maryland Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) Program. Citizens will have the opportunity to discuss the proposed projects and to provide input on other needs to be considered. The public hearing on the grant applications below will be held as part of the Talbot County Council's meeting agenda on Tuesday, August 22, 2023 at 5:30 p.m.State Fiscal Year 2024 CDBG application: · St. Vincent de Paul (SVDP) - 29533 Canvasback Drive, Easton, MD 21601? The original request for $465,000 in CDBG funding to expand the SVDP facility has been approved. After consulting with various engineering firms, SVDP is increasing the addition from 1,920 square feet to 2,400 square feet and enlarging the parking lot. The County will be requesting an additional $160,000 in CDBG funds for this modification.SVDP provides food, shelter, clothing, financial help and comfort to persons and families in need.Information detailing the estimated amount of CDBG funds available for SFY2024; range of activities that may be undertaken with CDBG funds; and proposed Talbot County projects under consideration are available for public review on the Talbot County Government website (www.talbotcountymd.gov) under Community, Grant Opportunities. Written comments on the CDBG draft application will be accepted until Monday, August 21, 2023 at 12:00 p.m. and should be addressed to: Chuck F. Callahan, President Talbot County Council 11 North Washington Street Easton, MD 21601 publiccomment@talbotcountymd.gov The Maryland CDBG Program is a federally funded program designed to assist governments with activities directed toward neighborhood and housing revitalization, economic development, and improved community facilities and services. It is administered by the Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD).The Maryland CDBG Program reflects the State's economic and community development priorities and provides public funds for activities that meet one of the following national objectives, in accordance with the federal Housing Community Development Act of 1974, as amended, that: 1. Benefit low and moderate income persons and households; 2. Aid in the prevention and elimination of slums or blight; 3. Meet other community development needs of an urgent nature, or that are an immediate threat to community health and welfare.Should you require communications assistance, please contact the County Manager's Office at (410) 770-8010 or TTY (410) 820-9377 by Monday, August 21, 2023. All interested parties are hereby notified and invited to attend.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY3031043 SD 8/11/2023

 NOTICE OF FINDING OF NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACT AND NOTICE OF INTENT TO REQUEST RELEASE OF FUNDSMaryland Department of Housing and Community Development Community Development Administration 7800 Harkins Road Lanham, Maryland 20706 Date: August 9, 2023 These notices shall satisfy two separate but related procedural requirements for activities to be undertaken by the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development (the "Agency").REQUEST FOR RELEASE OF FUNDSOn or about September 4, 2023 the Agency will submit a request to the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), Baltimore Field Office for the release of Federal funds under HOME Investment Partnerships Program (Title II of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act), as amended, to undertake a project known as: Project Name: Laurel Grove Project Acres 1 3460 Laurel Grove road, Federalsburg, Maryland 21632 The proposed project will be the renovation of the existing multifamily Laurel Grove Acres development.The renovations will include such things as increasing accessibility with ADA compliant features such as sidewalks, door size, parking and bathroom fixtures The project will also include landscaping changes that will increase head clearance and remove all tripping hazards. The project will include an upgraded Office, Laundry room and Maintenance facility.Total estimated cost of the project: $12,404,421.00 Total Investment from the HOME Program approximately $ 1,500,000.00 FINDING OF NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACTThe Agency has determined that the project will have no significant impact on the human environment.Therefore, an Environmental Impact Statement under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA) is not required. Additional project information is contained in the Environmental Review Record (ERR) on file at the above address and may be examined or copied weekdays 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.PUBLIC COMMENTSAny individual, group, or agency disagreeing with this determination or wishing to comment on the project may submit written comments to the Agency. All comments received by September 1, 2023 will be considered by the Agency prior to authorizing submission of a request for release of funds.Commentators should specify which Notice they are addressing.RELEASE OF FUNDSThe Agency certifies to HUD that Jack Daniels, in his official capacity as CDA Lending and Risk Director, Special Loans and Administration, Single Family Housing, consents to accept the jurisdiction of the Federal Courts if an action is brought to enforce responsibilities in relation to the environmental review process and that these responsibilities have been satisfied. HUD's approval of the certification satisfies its' responsibilities under NEPA and related laws and authorities and allows the Agency to use Program funds.OBJECTIONS TO RELEASE OF FUNDSHUD will accept objections to its release of funds and the Agency's certification for a period of fifteen days following the anticipated submission date or its actual receipt of the request (whichever is later) only if they are on one of the following bases: (a) the certification was not executed by the Certifying Officer of the Agency; (b) the Agency has omitted a step or failed to make a decision or finding required by HUD regulations at 24 CFR Part 58; (c) the grant recipient or other participants in the development process have committed funds, incurred costs or undertaken activities not authorized by 24 CFR Part 58 before approval of a release of funds by HUD; or (d) another Federal agency acting pursuant to 40 CFR Part 1504 has submitted a written finding that the project is unsatisfactory from the standpoint of environmental quality.Objections must be prepared and submitted to HUD in accordance with the required procedure (24 CFR Part 58), and shall be addressed the HUD Baltimore Field Office, Bank of America Bldg. Tower II, 100 S. Charles Street, 5th Floor, Baltimore, MD 21201-2505, Attention: Mr.Ronnie Legette Sr., Acting Director, Community Planning and Development Division or E/mailed to Ronnie.Legette@HUD.gov Potential objectors should contact HUD at 410-209-6546, to verify the actual last day of the objection period.Jack Daniels CDA Lending and Risk Director Special Loans and Administration Single Family Housing Jack.daniels2@maryland.gov 3031088 TR 8/16/2023 Robertson, Anschutz, Schneid & Crane, LLC 11350 McCormick Road, EP 1, Suite 302 Hunt Valley, MD 21031 470-321-7112 TRUSTEES' SALE OF VALUABLE FEE SIMPLE PROPERTY KNOWN AS 27865 LIBERTY RD FEDERALSBURG, MD 21632 Under a power of sale contained in that Deed of Trust dated January 25, 2008, and recorded in Liber 0806, folio 0047, of the land records of CAROLINE COUNTY, with an original principal balance of $270,000.00, default having occurred under the terms thereof, the appointed Substitute Trustees will offer for sale at public auction at THE CAROLINE COUNTY COURTHOUSE LOCATED AT 109 MARKET ST, DENTON, MD 21629 ON, AUGUST 21, 2023 at 2:30 PM ALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND together with any buildings or improvements thereon situated in CAROLINE COUNTY, MD, located at the above address and more fully described in the aforementioned Deed of Trust.TAX ID# - 05-025885 The property and improvements will be sold in an "AS IS" physical condition without warranty of any kind and subject to all conditions, restrictions and agreements of record affecting the same, including any condominium or homeowners association assessments pursuant to MD Real Property Article Â§ 11-110 and Â§ 11B-117.TERMS OF SALE: A non-refundable bidder's deposit of $17,000.00 by cashier's/certified check or such other form as the Substitute Trustee may determine, in their sole discretion, required at time of sale except for the party secured by the Deed of Trust. Risk of loss on purchaser from date and time of auction.The balance of the purchase price together with interest thereon at 4.33% per annum from date of sale to receipt of purchase price by Substitute Trustees must be paid by cashier's check within 10 days after final ratification of sale. The note holder shall not be obligated to pay interest if it is the purchaser. There will be no abatement of interest due from the purchaser in the event that additional funds are tendered before settlement or if settlement is delayed for any reason. All real estate taxes and other public charges and/or assessments to be adjusted as of the date of sale and thereafter assumed by purchaser. If applicable, any condominium and/or homeowners association dues and assessments that may become due after the date of sale shall be purchaser's responsibility. Purchaser shall pay all transfer, documentary and recording taxes/fees and all other settlement costs. Purchaser is responsible for obtaining possession of the property. Time is of the essence for the purchaser. If purchaser defaults, deposit will be forfeited and property resold at the risk and cost of the defaulting purchaser who shall be liable for any deficiency in the purchase price and all costs, expenses and attorney's fees of both sales. If Substitute Trustees do not convey title for any reason, purchaser's sole remedy is return of deposit without interest.This sale is subject to post-sale audit of the status of the loan secured by the Deed of Trust including but not limited to determining whether prior to sale a bankruptcy was filed; forbearance, repayment or other agreement was entered into; or loan was reinstated or paid off. In any such event this sale shall be null and void and purchaser's sole remedy shall be return of deposit without interest.File No. (21-134675) KEITH YACKO, DAVID WILLIAMSON, BRYSON STEPHEN, THOMAS GARTNER, Substitute Trustees Harvey West Auctioneers 300 E. Joppa Rd Hampton Plaza-Suite 1103 Baltimore, MD 21286 www.hwestauctions.com 410-769-9797 3027398 TR 8/2,8/9,8/16/2023 McCabe, Weisberg & Conway, LLC 312 Marshall Avenue, Suite 800 Laurel, MD 20707 www.mwc-law.com SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEES' SALE OF IMPROVED REAL PROPERTY 14595 FOX CHASE CIR.RIDGELY, MD 21660 Under a power of sale contained in a certain Deed of Trust from Monique Herzberger and Jeffrey Thomas Figiel, dated October 9, 2003 and recorded in Liber 550, folio 946 among the Land Records of Caroline County, MD, default having occurred under the terms thereof and at the request of the parties secured thereby, the undersigned Substitute Trustees will offer for sale at public auction at the Circuit Court for Caroline County, at the Court House Door, 109 Market St., Denton, MD 21629, on AUGUST 29, 2023 AT 10:55 AM ALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND AND THE IMPROVEMENTS THEREON situated in Caroline County, Maryland and more fully described in the aforesaid Deed of Trust. The property is improved by a dwelling.The property, will be sold in an "as is" condition and subject to conditions, restrictions, easements, encumbrances and agreements of record affecting the subject property, if any, and with no warranty of any kind.Terms of Sale: A deposit in the form of cashier's or certified check, or in such other form as the Substitute Trustees may determine, at their sole discretion, for $5,000 at the time of sale. If the note holder and/or servicer is the successful bidder, the deposit requirement is waived. Balance of the purchase price is to be paid within ten (10) days of the final ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Caroline County, Maryland. Interest is to be paid on the unpaid purchase price at the rate of 5% per annum from date of sale to the date the funds are received in the office of the Substitute Trustees, if the property is purchased by an entity other than the noteholder and/or servicer. If payment of the balance does not occur within ten (10) days of ratification, the deposit will be forfeited as liquidated damages. The purchaser agrees that the property may be resold pursuant to an order of court, waives personal service upon themselves and/or any principal or corporate designee of any documents filed regarding the failure to pay the purchase price within ten (10) days of ratification and expressly agrees to accept service by first class mail of said documents at the address provided by the purchaser in the Memorandum of Sale. The purchaser will not be entitled to any surplus or profits arising from the resale even if they are the result of improvements made by the purchaser. There will be no abatement of interest due from the purchaser in the event settlement is delayed for any reason. Taxes, ground rent, water rent, and all other public charges and assessments payable on an annual basis, including sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges, and front foot benefit charges, if applicable, to be adjusted for the current year to the date of sale, and assumed thereafter by the purchaser. Condominium fees and/or homeowners association dues, if any, shall be assumed by the purchaser from the date of sale. The purchaser shall be responsible for the payment of the ground rent escrow, if required. Cost of all documentary stamps, transfer taxes (including agricultural transfer taxes, if applicable), and all settlement charges shall be borne by the purchaser. The sale is subject to a post sale audit of the loan, including but not limited to an analysis of whether the borrower entered into a loan modification agreement, filed bankruptcy, reinstated or paid off the loan prior to the sale. The Substitute Trustees will convey either insurable or marketable title. If the Substitute Trustees are unable to convey insurable or marketable title or, the post sale audit concludes that the sale should not have occurred, or the sale is not ratified by the court for any reason, the purchaser's sole remedy in law or equity shall be limited to the refund of the deposit without interest even if the purchaser has made improvements to the property. Upon refund of the deposit, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Substitute Trustees. Purchaser shall be responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property. The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the property immediately after the sale. (Matter #18-602836).Laura H. G. O'sullivan, et al., Substitute Trustees 3030469 TR 8/9,8/16,8/23/2023 IN THE DISTRICT COURT THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICT Civil Action Case No. 2023-DR-45 STATE OF WYOMING) COUNTY OF LINCOLN) ss Plaintiff/Petitioner: Jeremy Gauthier) vs.) Defendant/Respondent: Jennifer Coleman) NOTICE TO JENNIFER COLEMAN, DEFENDANT/RESPONDENT DEFENDANT/RESPONDENT's CURRENT ADDRESS: 408 MALLARD DRIVE, GREENSBORO, MD 21639 You are notified that a Complaint for Divorce, Civil Action No.2023-DR-45, has been filed in the Wyoming District Court for the Third Judicial District, whose address is 925 Sage Ave, Kemmerer, WY 83101 seeking dissolution of your marriage to Jeremy Gauthier, in his/her favor.Unless you file an Answer or otherwise respond to the Complaint or Petition referenced above within 30 days following the last date of publication of this notice, a default judgment will be taken against you and a Decree of Divorce will be granted.DATED this 26th day of July, 2023.BY CLERK OF COURT: AMBER BRUNSKI Clerk of District Court/Deputy 3030123 TR 8/9,8/16,8/23,8/30/2023 Robertson, Anschutz, Schneid & Crane, LLC 11350 McCormick Road, EP 1, Suite 302 Hunt Valley, MD 21031 470-321-7112 TRUSTEES' SALE OF VALUABLE FEE SIMPLE PROPERTY KNOWN AS 9510 QUAIL RUN RD DENTON, MD 21629 Under a power of sale contained in that Deed of Trust dated August 25, 2009, and recorded in Liber 877, folio 299, of the land records of CAROLINE COUNTY, with an original principal balance of $104,008.00, default having occurred under the terms thereof, the appointed Substitute Trustees will offer for sale at public auction at THE CAROLINE COUNTY COURTHOUSE LOCATED AT 109 MARKET ST, DENTON, MD 21629 ON, AUGUST 21, 2023 at 2:30 PM ALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND together with any buildings or improvements thereon situated in CAROLINE COUNTY, MD, located at the above address and more fully described in the aforementioned Deed of Trust.TAX ID# - Lord Clerk of the Circuit Court Caroline County, Maryland 3031192 TR 8/16,8/23,8/30/2023 MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT WATER and SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF COMMENT PERIOD REGARDING THE LIMITED REMAND OF THE FINAL GENERAL PERMIT FOR DISCHARGES FROM STORMWATER ASSOCIATED WITH INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITIES, DISCHARGE PERMIT NO. 20-SW (NPDES PERMIT NO. MDR0000) The Department published a Final Determination to issue the General Permit For Discharges From Stormwater Associated With Industrial Activities, Discharge Permit No. 20-SW, NPDES Permit No. MDR0000 (the "20-SW") on November 18, 2022, and the 20-SW became effective February 1, 2023. The Department's Final Determination was challenged in the Circuit Court for Baltimore County (case numbers C-03-CV-22-005075, C-03-CV-22-005086, C-03-CV-22-005087).In accordance with an order from the Circuit Court, the Department has agreed to a limited remand to accept comments on the following sections of the 20-SW: Part I.F, Part V.A.2.b, and Part III.C. The 20-SW remains in effect pending a final decision by the Department on these sections. The remainder of the 20-SW is final and not open for public comment.The Department proposes to re-issue these sections of the 20-SW as published in the Department's Final Determination on November 18, 2022. However, the Department will consider comments on these sections and evaluate potential changes based on the comments received during this public comment period. The current 20-SW permit, further background, and details can be found on the Department's website at: https://mdewwp.page.link/ISW.Written comments on these sections of the 20-SW will be considered if received by Paul Hlavinka by email at paul.hlavinka@maryland.gov or by mailing to Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd., Suite 455, Baltimore, MD 21230-1708, or (fax) 410-537-3163.A public hearing to accept oral comments will be held on September 28, 2023, from 10 a.m. to Noon at the Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd, Baltimore, MD 21230. Comments received in writing or received at a public hearing are given equal consideration.The comment period closes at 5:00 PM, Tuesday, November 14, 2023. This comment period already incorporates the additional 60-day period provided in §1-606(d)(1)(ii) of the Environment Article, Annotated Code of Maryland.3031956 TR 8/23,8/30/2023 IN THE DISTRICT The property is improved by a dwelling.The property, will be sold in an "as is" condition and subject to conditions, restrictions, easements, encumbrances and agreements of record affecting the subject property, if any, and with no warranty of any kind.Terms of Sale: A deposit in the form of cashier's or certified check, or in such other form as the Substitute Trustees may determine, at their sole discretion, for $5,000 at the time of sale. If the noteholder and/or servicer is the successful bidder, the deposit requirement is waived. Balance of the purchase price is to be paid within ten (10) days of the final ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Caroline County, Maryland. Interest is to be paid on the unpaid purchase price at the rate of 5% per annum from date of sale to the date the funds are received in the office of the Substitute Trustees, if the property is purchased by an entity other than the noteholder and/or servicer. If payment of the balance does not occur within ten (10) days of ratification, the deposit will be forfeited as liquidated damages. The purchaser agrees that the property may be resold pursuant to an order of court, waives personal service upon themselves and/or any principal or corporate designee of any documents filed regarding the failure to pay the purchase price within ten (10) days of ratification and expressly agrees to accept service by first class mail of said documents at the address provided by the purchaser in the Memorandum of Sale. The purchaser will not be entitled to any surplus or profits arising from the resale even if they are the result of improvements made by the purchaser. There will be no abatement of interest due from the purchaser in the event settlement is delayed for any reason. Taxes, ground rent, water rent, and all other public charges and assessments payable on an annual basis, including sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges, and front foot benefit charges, if applicable, to be adjusted for the current year to the date of sale, and assumed thereafter by the purchaser. Condominium fees and/or homeowners association dues, if any, shall be assumed by the purchaser from the date of sale. The purchaser shall be responsible for the payment of the ground rent escrow, if required. Cost of all documentary stamps, transfer taxes (including agricultural transfer taxes, if applicable), and all settlement charges shall be borne by the purchaser. The sale is subject to a post sale audit of the loan, including but not limited to an analysis of whether the borrower entered into a loan modification agreement, filed bankruptcy, reinstated or paid off the loan prior to the sale. The Substitute Trustees will convey either insurable or marketable title. If the Substitute Trustees are unable to convey insurable or marketable title or, the post sale audit concludes that the sale should not have occurred, or the sale is not ratified by the court for any reason, the purchaser's sole remedy in law or equity shall be limited to the refund of the deposit without interest even if the purchaser has made improvements to the property. Upon refund of the deposit, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Substitute Trustees. Purchaser shall be responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property. The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the property immediately after the sale. The application and related information are on file with the Administration at the main office; arrangements may be made for inspection and copying. Opportunity is afforded for individuals to provide written comments, to request a public informational hearing or to be placed on an interested persons list for the listed application. Any further notices about actions on an application will be provided only by mail to those individuals on a mailing list of interested persons. Comments or requests for a public informational hearing must be received in writing by the Administration on or before September 6, 2023. All inquiries and requests should include the permit application number; your name, address and telephone number; and should be addressed to Robert Peoples, Chief, Source Protection and Water Appropriation Division, Water and Science Administration, 1800 Washington Blvd, Baltimore, Maryland 21230. Telephone: (410) 537-3590.Caroline County CO2022G002/01 - Schmick Farms, LLC, 3321 Choptank Road, Preston, Maryland, has applied to appropriate and use an annual average of 116,000 gallons of groundwater per day (gpd) and an average during the month of maximum use of 617,000 gpd for crop irrigation. Water will be withdrawn from one new well and one existing well in the Columbia aquifer. The project is located within 0.3 mile south of the junction of Poplar Neck and Dover Bridge Roads, Preston, Caroline County, Maryland.The wells will be about 90 feet deep. Impacts to the resource and nearby users were evaluated using aquifer data from geologic reports available to the Administration. Pumping during periods of maximum use may lower the water table less than 2.4 feet at a distance of 800 feet (estimated nearest well). Changes in water levels decreased at greater distances. In making the evaluation, the withdrawal was modeled as being pumped continuously for 60 days at the maximum rate with no recharge to the aquifer. No unreasonable impacts to the Columbia aquifer or other users of the Columbia aquifer are expected.3031972 TR 8/23/2023NOTICE OF APPOINTMENT NOTICE TO CREDITORS NOTICE TO UNKNOWN HEIRS Estate No. 11139 TO ALL PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE ESTATE OF MARK E. These are classic examples of 'Public Notices' as they involve official legal disclosures and governmental proceedings.

Lord Clerk of the Circuit Court Caroline County, Maryland3031192 TR 8/16,8/23,8/30/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENTWATER and SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF COMMENT PERIOD REGARDING THE LIMITED REMAND OF THE FINAL GENERAL PERMIT FOR DISCHARGES FROM STORMWATER ASSOCIATED WITH INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITIES, DISCHARGE PERMIT NO. 20-SW (NPDES PERMIT NO. MDR0000)The Department published a Final Determination to issue the General Permit For Discharges From Stormwater Associated With Industrial Activities, Discharge Permit No. 20-SW, NPDES Permit No. MDR0000 (the "20-SW) on November 18, 2022, and the 20-SW became effective February 1, 2023. The Department's Final Determination was challenged in tine Circuit Court for Baltimore County (case numbers C-03-CV-22-005075, C-03-CV-22-005086, C-03-CV-22-005087). In accordance with an order from the Circuit Court, the Department has agreed to a limited remand to accept comments on the following sections of the 20-SW: Part I.F, Part V.A.2.b, and Part III.C. The 20-SW remains in effect pending a final decision by the Department on these sections. The remainder of the 20-SW is final and not open for public comment.The Department proposes to re-issue these sections of the 20-SW as published in the Department's Final Determination on November 18, 2022. However, the Department will consider comments on these sections and evaluate potential changes based on the comments received during this public comment period. The current 20-SW permit, further background, and details can be found on the Department's website at: https://mdewwp.page.link/ISW.Witten comments on these sections of the 20-SW will be considered if received by Paul Hlavinka by email at paul.hlavinka@maryland.gov or by mailing to Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd., Suite 455, Baltimore, MD 21230-1708, or (fax) 410-537-3163. A public hearing to accept oral comments will be held on September 28.2023. from 10 a.m. to Noon at the Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd, Baltimore, MD 21230. Comments received in writing or received at a public hearing are given equal consideration.The comment period closes at 5:00 PM, Tuesday. November 14. 2023. This comment period already incorporates the additional 60-day period provided in §1-606(d)(1)(H) of the Environment Article, Annotated Code of Maryland.3031956 TR 8/23,8/30/2023IN THE DISTRICT COURT THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICTCivil Action Case No. 2023-DR-45 STATE OF WYOMING) COUNTY OF LINCOLN) ss Plaintiff/Petitioner: Jeremy Gauthier) vs.Defendant/Respondent: Jennifer ColemanNOTICE OF PUBLICATIONNOTICE TO JENNIFER COLEMAN, DEFENDANT/RESPONDENTDEFENDANT/RESPONDENT's CURRENT ADDRESS: 408 MALLARD DRIVE, GREENSBORO, MD 21639You are notified that a Complaint for Divorce, Civil Action No. 2023-DR-45, has been filed in the Wyoming District Court for the Third Judicial District, whose address is 925 Sage Ave, Kemmerer, WY 83101 seeking dissolution of your marriage to Jeremy Gauthier, in his/her favor.Unless you file an Answer or otherwise respond to the Complaint or Petition referenced above within 30 days following the last date of publication of this notice, a default judgment will be taken against you and a Decree of Divorce will be granted.DATED this 26th day of July, 2023.BY CLERK OF COURT: AMBER BRUNSKI Clerk of District Court/Deputy3030123 TR 8/9,8/16,8/23,8/30/2023IN THE CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE COUNTY OF CAROLINE, MARYLANDCIVIL NO: C-05-CV-23-000049WILLIAM M. SAVAGE, etal. Trustee(s) Plaintiff(s) vs.MONIQUE HERZBERGER JEFFREY THOMAS FIGIELDefendant(s)Mortgagor(s)NOTICENOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN this 28th day of August, 2023. by the Circuit Court for Caroline, Maryland and by the authority thereof, that the sale made by William M. Savage, Gregory N. Britto, Trustees, of the Real Property designated as 14595 Fox-chase Circle, Ridgely, MD 21660, and reported in the above entitled cause, will be finally ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary thereof be shown on or before the 28th day of September, 2023. next; provided a copy of this order be inserted in TIMES RECORD, PO BOX, PO BOX 160, Denton, MD 21629 published in said County of Caroline, once a week for three successive weeks before the 21st day of September, 2023.The report states the amount of the sale to be $200,000.00.Terry B. LordCLERK OF THE CIRCUIT COURT FOR COUNTY OF CAROLINE 3032670 TR 8/30,9/6,9/13/2023GREENSPOON MARDER, LLP 201 International Circle, Suite 230 Hunt Valley, MD 21030SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE's SALE OF IMPROVED REAL PROPERTY KNOWN AS 104 MAPLE AVE Preston, MD 21655By virtue of a power of sale contained in a Deed of Trust from PHILIP HENRY EWING JR, dated July 27, 2011 and recorded in book 969, page 071 among the Land Records of CAROLINE COUNTY, Maryland, default having occurred thereunder (Foreclosure Case docketed as Case No. C-05-CV-22-000007; Tax ID No. 04-010639) the Substitute Trustee will sell at public auction CAROLINE COUNTY courthouse located at 109 MARKET ST, DENTON, MD 21629.SEPTEMBER 15, 2023 at 1:00 PMALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND and improvements thereon situated in CAROLINE COUNTY, MD and more fully described in above referenced Deed of Trust.The property will be sold in an "as is" condition and subject to conditions, restrictions and agreements of record affecting the same, if any and with no warranty of any kind.Terms of Sale: A deposit of $ 13,000.00 will be required at the time of sale, such deposit to be in CERTIFIED CHECK OR BY CASHIER's CHECK, CASH WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. Balance of the purchase price to be paid in cash within ten days of final ratification of sale by the Circuit Court for CAROLINE COUNTY. Time is of the essence as to the purchaser. If the purchaser defaults, the deposit shall be forfeited and the property shall be resold at the purchaser's risk and expense. The purchaser waives personal service and accepts service by first class mail and certified mail addressed to the address provided by said Purchaser as identified on the Memorandum of Sale for any Motion or Show Cause Order incident to this sale including a Motion to Default Purchaser and for Resale of the Property. In the event of a resale, the defaulting purchaser shall not be entitled to receive any benefit from the resale, including, but not limited to, additional proceeds or surplus which may arise therefrom. Interest to be paid on the unpaid purchase money at five percent (5%) from the date of sale to the date funds are received by the Substitute Trustee. There will be no abatement of interest in the event additional funds are tendered at the time of sale or any time prior to settlement or if the settlement is delayed for any reason. In the event that the Secured Party executes a forbearance agreement with the borrower(s) described in the above-mentioned Deed of Trust, or allows the borrower(s) to execute their right to reinstate or payoff the subject loan, prior to the sale, with or without the Substitute Trustee's prior knowledge, this Contract shall be null and void and of no effect, and the Purchaser's sole remedy shall be the return of the deposit without interest. Purchaser shall pay for documentary stamps, transfer taxes and settlement expenses. Taxes, ground rent, water rent, condominium fees and/or homeowner association dues, all public charges/assessments payable on an annual basis, including sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges, if applicable, shall be adjusted to the date of sale and assumed thereafter by the purchaser. Purchaser shall be responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property. Purchaser assumes the risk of loss or damage to the property from the date of sale forward. If the Substitute Trustee is unable to convey insurable title for any reason, the Purchaser's sole remedy in law or equity shall be limited to a refund of the aforementioned deposit without interest. In the event the sale is not ratified for any reason, the Purchaser's sole remedy, at law or equity, is the return of the deposit without interest. (File # 68612.0121)SYDNEY E. ROBERSON, NICOLE LIPINSKI, MARC MEDEL, Substitute Trustee (s)ANNE C. llm_classification.explanation: The article contains multiple legal notices, court proceedings, property sales, and estate announcements, which directly align with the 'Public Notices' category. While there is some overlap with 'Local Government,' the primary focus is on formal legal notifications rather than governmental operations.

title: Legal Notices
content:
Legal Notices

 August 31, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: A20 | Section: Legal Notices 
 
 622
 Words 

 Read News Document

 ABANDONED VESSEL Notice is hereby given that the following vessel has apparently been abandoned for 180 days on the property of DiMillo's on the Chesapeake at 202 Bank St. Oxford, MD 21654 410-226-0100. The vessel is described as a blue 1967 Lyman 26 Hardtop with the name Evthokia and hull ID R1005. Application for title will be made in accordance with Section 8-722 of the Annotated Code of Maryland, Natural Resources Article if this vessel is not claimed, storage fees paid and removed from the above property within 30 days of this notice.3032776 SD 8/31/2023NOTICE OF SALE OF GOODS District Court for Talbot County, Maryland Case: D-035-CV-23-007348 (PIZAZZZZ!)The Talbot County Sheriff's Office will sell at auction goods levied under distress from Pizazzzz!, 100 Talbot Street, St. Michaels, Maryland 21601, pursuant to order of the District Court for Talbot County, Maryland, entered on June 29, 2023, in Murden vs. Pizazz, LLC, a/k/a Pizazzz, LLC, Case No. D-035-CV-23-007348.The goods to be sold consist of fashion accessories (purses, jewelry, bags, clothing, etc.) and retail store furnishings.The sale shall commence online at 8:00 AM, on Monday, September 18, 2023, at: Caronna Estate Sales https://caronnaestatesales.com/auctions/The Talbot County Sheriff's Office may be reached at c/o Kristy Conde, (410) 822-1020, Talbot County Sheriff's Office, 28712 Glebe Road, Suite 1, Easton, Maryland 21601.3032216 SD 8/24,8/25,8/27,8/30,8/31,9/1,9/3,9/6,9/7,9/8/2023TOWN OF GREENSBORO, MARYLAND INVITATION TO BIDDERS Sealed BIDS, in duplicate, will be received by Town of Greensboro Town Hall, 113 S Main Street PO BOX 340, Greensboro, MD 21639 for the Town of Greensboro Road Rehabilitation Plans - Phase II. Bids will be accepted by the Town of Greensboro, until 4:00 PM, on Friday, September 22, 2023 at which time they will be opened publicly and read aloud. It is the bidder's responsibility to confirm with the Town that bid documents were received. The last day to ask questions in writing is 4:00 pm, on Friday, September 15, 2023. Send questions to Tammy Kelledes at tkelledes@greensboromd.com. Work includes milling and repaving existing roads within the Town limits of Greensboro, and all other specified work as shown in the contract documents.Interested bidders are encouraged to attend a pre-bid meeting to be held on Tuesday, September 12, 2023 at 9 a.m. at the Town Hall, Town of Greensboro, 113 S Main Street, PO BOX 340, Greensboro, MD 21639.The right is reserved as the interest of the Town of Greensboro may appear, to reject any and all bids, to waive any informality or irregularity in bids received, and to accept or reject any items of any bid.The Owner may extend the time and place for the opening of the bids from that described in the invitation, with not less than two (2) calendar days notice to those bidders receiving plans.Town of Greensboro By: Tammy Kelledes Town Manager 3032764 SD 8/31/2023IN THE CIRCUIT COURT FOR TALBOT COUNTY, MARYLAND Case No. C-20-CV-23-000063 Diane Rosenberg, et al.4340 East West Highway, Suite 600 Bethesda, MD 20814 Substitute Trustees Plaintiff(s) v.James L Storm 21384 Seth Avenue Tilghman, MD 21671 Defendant(s) NOTICE Notice is hereby given this 21st day of August, 2023, by the Circuit Court for Talbot County, Maryland, that the sale of 21384 Seth Avenue, Tilghman, MD 21671, made and reported, will be ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary thereof be shown on or before the 20th day of September, 2023, provided a copy of this notice be inserted in The Star Democrat a daily newspaper printed in said County, once in each of three successive weeks before the 10th day of September, 2023. The Report of Sale states the amount of the foreclosure sale price to be $128,000.00.Kathleen M. Duvall Clerk of the Circuit Court Talbot County, Maryland 3032146 SD 8/24,8/31,9/7/2023 

 © Copyright © 2023 Star Democrat, Chesapeake Publishing Group (Adams Publishing/APGMedia). All rights reserved.

title: Legal Notices
content:
Legal Notices

 Page: A22 | Section: Legal Notices

 Words

 TOWN OF SECRETARY PUBLIC HEARINGA public hearing has been scheduled for 7:00 p.m. on Tuesday, September 5, 2023 at 122 Main St., Secretary, Maryland, 21664, on an Ordinance of the Commissioners of Secretary (the "Town") authorizing the issuance, upon the full faith and credit of the Town, of a general obligation installment bond in the principal amount not to exceed One Million One Hundred Forty-Nine Thousand Dollars ($1,149,000) under the authority of Sections 19-207 and 19-301 et seq. of the Local Government Article of the Annotated Code of Maryland (2013 Replacement Volume, as amended) and the Charter of the Town, including Section 114 thereof, to be designated "Town of Secretary General Obligation Bond (Wastewater Treatment Plant Upgrade Project)," as such designation may be modified (the "Bond"); the net proceeds of the sale of the Bond to be used and applied for the public purpose of financing and refinancing a portion of the costs of upgrading the Town's wastewater treatment plant, including the repayment of certain interim indebtedness, together with the acquisition of all necessary property rights and equipment, together with any related construction, architectural, financial, fiscal, legal, design, planning and engineering expenses; prescribing the form and tenor of the Bond and the terms and conditions for the issuance and sale of the Bond; providing for the levy and collection of any taxes for the prompt payment of the maturing principal of and interest on the Bond that the full faith and credit and taxing power of the Town be irrevocably and unconditionally pledged to the payment of the principal and interest on the Bond.If there are any questions, please call the Town Hall at 410-9433113 during regular business hours.Susan B. Dukes, Mayor 3032305 SD8/25,9/1/2023INVITATION TO BIDArchitectural & Engineering Firm seeking a Licensed Contractor to provide process piping and electrical modifications for the Town of Queenstown Wastewater Treatment Plant.Work consists of process piping modifications, actuator installation, control panel installation, wiring and other associated work as illustrated in the contract documents. Work to be completed within 60 calendar days of Notice to Proceed.Bids due by 2pm, Wednesday, 09/22/23. More info in packet. The Firm reserves the right to reject any and all bids and to waive any requirement.A Prebid Meeting will be held on site Wednesday, 9/6/23 at 1pm at 120 Skipjack Cove Ln. Queenstown, MD 21658Bid Documents available in hard copy for $25.00 or via email no cost by contacting:RAUCH inc.106 N. Harrison StreetEaston, MD 21601Phone: 410-770-9081Email: jeannie@raucheng.com atAn Equal Opportunity Employer 3032780 SD8/30,9/1,9/6,9/8/2023PUBLIC NOTICE TOWN OF HURLOCKCHARTER AMENDMENT RESOLUTION 2023-1Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 of the Council of the Town of Hurlock is to modify the tiered salary and educational incentives system for members of the council. The Charter of the Town of Hurlock currently provides for a tiered salary system for Councilmembers based on an initial term with salary increases for up to three consecutive terms along with a salary incentive for the completion of certain training benchmarks. Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 will amend Article III, Section 303 to further define a full term in order to be eligible for the next tier and to drop the "consecutive" term requirements.Being that Charter Amendment Resolution 2023-1 was passed by the Council of Hurlock during the Open Session Meeting of August 14, 2023 and will be advertised for four consecutive weeks and a true copy is posted in the Hurlock Town Office will become effective on the 3rd day of October 2023 unless a Proper Petition for Referendum shall have been filed on or before the 40th day after the passage of this Resolution.John H. AveryTown Manager 3031652 SD8/18,8/25,9/1,9/8/2023PUBLIC NOTICE 2023 HURLOCK ELECTIONSThe Town of Hurlock will hold elections for the District 3 and 4 Councilmember seats November 4, 2023.The deadline to file for election is October 2, 2023 by 4 pm. Town residents interested in filing for election should contact The Hurlock Town Office at 410-943-4181 for details. Potential candidates must be at least 25 years old and shall have resided in the Town for at least one year preceding their election, and shall be qualified voters of the Town. They must reside within their potential district.The deadline to register to vote is October 13, 2023 by 4 pm.John Avery Town Manager3032321 SD 8/25,9/1/2023NOTICE OF SALE OF GOODS District Court for Talbot County, Maryland Case: D-035-CV-23-007348 (PIZAZZZZ!)The Talbot County Sheriff's Office will sell at auction goods levied under distress from Pizazzzz!, 100 Talbot Street, St. Michaels, Maryland 21601, pursuant to order of the District Court for Talbot County, Maryland, entered on June 29, 2023, in Murden vs. Pizazz, LLC, a/k/a Pizazzz, LLC, Case No. D-035-CV-23-007348.The goods to be sold consist of fashion accessories (purses, jewelry, bags, clothing, etc.) and retail store furnishings.The sale shall commence online at 8:00 AM, on Monday, September 18, 2023, at:Caronna Estate Sales https://caronnaestatesales.com/auctions/The Talbot County Sheriff's Office may be reached at c/o Kristy Conde, (410) 822-1020, Talbot County Sheriff's Office, 28712 Glebe Road, Suite 1, Easton, Maryland 21601.3032216 SD 8/24,8/25,8/27,8/30,8/31,9/1,9/3,9/6,9/7,9/8/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICENotice is hereby given that a public hearing will be held by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, September 12, 2023 at 5:30 p.m. in the Bradley Meeting Room, South Wing, Talbot County Courthouse, 11 North Washington St., Easton, Maryland 21601 for consideration of Bill No. 1547, A BILL TO AMEND CHAPTER 11 OF THE TALBOT COUNTY CODE (ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES) REGARDING OPERATIONS OF CLASS I ALCOHOL DISPENSARY BISTROS.The public is encouraged to submit written comments on Bill No. 1547 to PublicCommentiStalbotcountvmd.gov by Noon on Thursday, September 7, 2023. Comments submitted will be made a part of the public record.Individuals interested in obtaining a copy of the Bill may contact the Office of the County Manager during regular office hours. The Bill is also posted on the County's website at www.talbotcountvmd.gov. If you require communications assistance, please contact the County Manager's Office at (410) 770-8010 or TTY (410) 822-8735 by Monday, September 11, 2023.All interested parties are hereby notified and invited to comment.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3032323 SD 8/25,9/1/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENTWATER and SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF COMMENT PERIOD REGARDING THE LIMITED REMAND OF THE FINAL GENERAL PERMIT FOR DISCHARGES FROM STORMWATER ASSOCIATED WITH INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITIES, DISCHARGE PERMIT NO. 20-SW (NPDES PERMIT NO. MDR0000)The Department published a Final Determination to issue the General Permit For Discharges From Stormwater Associated With Industrial Activities, Discharge Permit No. 20-SW, NPDES Permit No. MDR0000 (the "20-SW) on November 18, 2022, and the 20-SW became effective February 1, 2023. The Department's Final Determination was challenged in the Circuit Court for Baltimore County (case numbers C-03-CV-22-005075, C-03-CV-22-005086, C-03-CV-22-005087). In accordance with an order from the Circuit Court, the Department has agreed to a limited remand to accept comments on the following sections of the 20-SW: Part I.F, Part V.A.2.b, and Part IMC. The 20-SW remains in effect pending a final decision by the Department on these sections. The remainder of the 20-SW is final and not open for public comment.The Department proposes to re-issue these sections of the 20-SW as published in the Department's Final Determination on November 18, 2022. However, the Department will consider comments on these sections and evaluate potential changes based on the comments received during this public comment period. The current 20-SW permit, further background, and details can be found on the Department's website at: https://mdewwp.page.link/ISW.Witten comments on these sections of the 20-SWwill be considered if received by Paul Hlavinka by email at paul.hlavinka@maryland.gov or by mailing to Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd., Suite 455, Baltimore, MD 21230-1708, or (fax) 410-537-3163. A public hearing to accept oral comments will be held on September 28.2023. from 10 a.m. to Noon at the Maryland Department of the Environment, 1800 Washington Blvd, Baltimore, MD 21230. Comments received in writing or received at a public hearing are given equal consideration.The comment period closes at 5:00 PM, Tuesday. November 14. 2023. This comment period already incorporates the additional 60-day period provided in §1-606(d)(1)(H) of the Environment Article, Annotated Code of Maryland.3031959 SD 8/25,9/1/2023NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARINGAppeal No. CAVR-23-8In accordance with Chapter 20, § 20-10 & § 20-11 of the Talbot County Code, notice is hereby given that a public hearing will be held in the Bradley Meeting Room, Court House, South Wing, 11 North Washington Street, Easton, Maryland on September 18, 2023 at 6:30 p.m. by the Talbot County Board of Appeals to hear the following petition:Scott and Kerry Cavender are requesting a variance to permit the demolition of an existing dwelling with patio located entirely within the Shoreline Development Buffer (located approximately 26' from MHW), and to permit the construction of a new replacement dwelling with patio in the same general location. The proposed replacement dwelling with patio will be setback at least 33' from MHW, and will result in a net reduction of lot coverage within the Shoreline Development Buffer relative to existing conditions. Request is made in accordance with Chapter 190 Zoning, Article III, §190-15.11 (C) 2 and Article VII, §190-58 of the Talbot County Code. Property is located at 8004 Bloomfield Road, Easton, Maryland 21601 in the Rural Conservation (RC) Zone. Property owners are Scott and Kerry Cavender and the property is located on Tax Map 33, Grid 17, Parcel 136. All persons are notified of said hearing and invited to attend. The Board reserves the right to close a portion of this hearing as authorized by Section 10-508 (a) of the Maryland Annotated Code.A copy of said petition is available for inspection during the regular office hours of the Talbot County Board of Appeals, 215 Bay Street, Suite 2, Easton, Maryland.Chris Corkell Board of Appeals3032297 SD 9/1,9/8/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICENOTICE TO PUBLIC OF FINDING OF NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACT AND NOTICE OF INTENT TO REQUEST RELEASE OF FUNDSDate: September 1, 2023 Name of Grantee: Talbot County, Maryland Government Address of Grantee: 11 North Washington Street, Easton, Maryland 21601 Phone Number of Grantee: (410)770-8010The purpose of this Notice is to satisfy two separate, but related procedural requirements for activities to be taken by Talbot County Government.On or about September 18, 2023 Talbot County Government will request that the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development release funds under the Maryland Community Development Block Grant Program to be used for the following project:Project Title: St. Vincent de Paul Addition and Renovation ProjectPurpose of Project: Addition and renovation of St. Vincent de Paul food pantry, counseling center and thrift store Project Location: 29533 Canvasback Drive, Easton, MarylandTotal Project Costs: $811,000Finding of No Significant ImpactNotice is hereby given that Talbot County Government has prepared an Environmental Review Record on the project described in this Notice and has determined that said project will have no significant impact on the human environment. Therefore, an Environmental Impact Statement under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is not required and no further environmental review of the project is proposed prior to requesting the Release of Funds.The Finding of No Significant Impact is based on the following:comments were requested from Maryland Department of the Environment, Maryland Historical Trust-MDP, Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Town of Easton and Talbot County Planning and Zoning. All agencies have reviewed the project and confirmed that the St. Vincent de Paul project does not conflict with their Department's goals, objectives or programs.The Environmental Review Record which documents the Environmental Review of these projects is available for public examination at the Talbot County Manager's Office during normal business days/hours (M-F 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.).Public Comments on FindingAll interested agencies, groups and persons disagreeing with this decision are invited to submit written comments respecting the environmental impacts of the described project to the Talbot County Manager's Office and to the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development. All such comments must be received no later than September 18, 2023. All comments will be considered and Talbot County Government will not request the release of funds nor take any action on the project prior to this date.Request for Release of FundsTalbot County Government will undertake the project described above with Maryland Community Development Block Grant Funds. This Notice also certifies that Chuck Callahan, serving in the official capacity of President, Talbot County Council, consents to accept the jurisdiction of the Federal Courts if an action is brought to enforce responsibilities in relation to environmental reviews decision-making, and action; and that these responsibilities have been satisfied. The State's approval of the certification satisfies its responsibility under NEPA and related laws and authorities, and allows Talbot County to use CDBG funds.Objections to Release of FundsObjections to the release of funds will be accepted by the Department of Housing and Community Development only if one or more of the following apply: (a) that the certification was not in fact executed by the Certifying Officer; or (b) that the Talbot County Government has omitted a step or failed to make a decision or finding required by HUD regulations at 24 CFR Part 58; or (c) the grant recipient or other participants in the development process have committed funds, incurred costs or undertaken activities not authorized by this part before Release of Funds and approval of the environmental certification by DHCD; or (d) another Federal agency acting pursuant to 40 CFR Part 1504 has submitted a written finding that the project is unsatisfactory from the standpoint of environmental quality. All interested agencies, groups, and persons disagreeing with this decision are invited to submit written comments to the Talbot County Government and to the CDBG Environmental Officer, MD Department of Housing and Community Development, 7800 Harkins Road, Lanham, Maryland 20706. All such comments must be received no later than COB October 4, 2023.3032970 SD 9/1/2023

title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 September 5, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: A2 | Section: News 
 
 101
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Caption: Patches is a charming senior calico who lost her home when her owner died. Patches has been diagnosed with an upper GI condition, but she hopes that will not stop you from adopting her. She has a tendency toward getting ringworm - regular medicated baths and keeping her fur trimmed are key to preventing flare-ups. This dazzling autumnal beauty is friendly and enjoys nothing more than making a new friend. She does well with cats, dogs and kids. We would love for her to finally find a FUR ever home or a long-term foster. Her adoption fee has been sponsored. Adoption Application: forms.gle/4U19x6VuytCXxUzn9 Foster Application: forms.gle/KxiSEC9gFgMppXzj8

title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 September 6, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: B8 | Section: News 
 
 134
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Meet Vander: The playful pup Looking for a forever home. Are you ready to welcome a bundle of joy into your life? Look no further, because Vander is here to steal your heart. At just 10 to 11 months old, Vander is the perfect mix of friendly, playful and funny. He's great with people, other pets and has a personality that will keep you entertained for hours on end. Vander's wagging tail and infectious energy will light up your home. Whether he's chasing his favorite toy or cuddling up next to you, he's always ready for adventure and affection.Give this lovable pup the forever home he deserves. If you're looking to add a furry friend to your family, Vander is the one. Contact us at 410-820-1600 or info@carolinehumane.org for more information.Open Tuesday to Saturday. 

 © Copyright © 2023 Star Democrat, Chesapeake Publishing Group (Adams Publishing/APGMedia). All rights reserved.

title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 September 12, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: 2 | Section: News 
 
 67
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Caption: Our Pet of the Week, sponsored by Easton Utilities Velocity are our kittens. We currently have 24 kittens available for adoption and over 30 kittens in foster care. All of our kittens are spayed and neutered before they go home, have had all age-appropriate vaccinations, and are micro chipped. There is no adoption fee for our kittens. Come in and meet your new furry baby today.

Phelps Register of Wills for Caroline County 109 Market St., Courthouse, Room 119 Denton, MD 216293033155 TR 9/6,9/13,9/20/2023NOTICE OF DENTON TOWN ELECTION ANDFILING BY CANDIDATESTuesday, November 7, 2023, 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.There will be an election held this date for the purpose of electing one Town Council member, to fulfill a five year term. All persons desiring to become a candidate for the Town Council shall have resided in the Town at least one year prior to election, shall be a registered voter of the Town of Denton, shall be at least 25 years of age, and shall file in accordance with the Denton Charter, Article V, Section C5-8 which reads in part as follows:Candidates for election to the office of the Denton Town Council shall file with the Board of Supervisors of Elections a petition signed by at least twenty (20) registered voters of the Town of Denton. The candidate shall file the petition for an elective office not less than thirty (30) days, including Sundays and holidays, priorto the date of such election. Such petition shall state the name and address of the candidate, the fact that such person is eligible for election of the office of council, and that such person wishes his/her name placed on the ballot as candidate. Such petition shall be sworn to by the person filing same, both as to the fact of the candidate's eligibility and as to the genuineness of the signatures on such petition. The Board of Supervisors of Elections shall advertise the filing requirements once weekly for one (1) month prior to the filing deadline in a paper circulated in the Town. No person shall be eligible for elective Town public office who has not fulfilled the requirements of this Section.A further requirement for candidates for election is found in Section 14-4 (D) of the Town of Denton Ethics Code. Petitions of candidacy will not be accepted by the Town of Denton or the Board of Election Supervisors unless the certificate is accompanied by a complete financial disclosure statement complying with the Town of Denton Ethics Code.The petition of candidacy and the completed financial disclosure statement must be delivered to the Denton Town Office, at 4 N. Second St., Denton, by 4:00 p.m., Friday, October 6, 2023. It is suggested that the petition be returned several hours prior to the 4:00 p.m. deadline so the names of the signers of the petition may be verified as registered voters. This will provide ample time to obtain additional signatures should any of the signatures prove to be invalid. llm_classification.explanation: The article consists entirely of legal and public notices related to property sales, estate proceedings, and court hearings, which align most closely with the 'Public Notices' category. While some content touches on local government processes, the primary focus is on formal announcements rather than governance or civic administration.

By virtue of the power and authority contained in a Deed of Trust, dated March 8, 2007, and recorded in Liber 750 at Page 485 among the land records of the County of Caroline, in the original principal amount of $205,467.52. Upon default and request for sale, the undersigned trustees will offer for sale at public auction at the Courthouse for the COUNTY OF CAROLINE, at Front of The Courthouse, Market Street, Denton, Maryland, on October 6, 2023 at 10:30 AM, all that property described in said Deed of Trust including but not limited to: Tax ID# 04-002164 Said property is in fee simple and is improved by a dwelling and is sold in "as is condition" and subject to all superior covenants, conditions, liens, restrictions, easement, rights-of-way, as may affect same, if any.TERMS OF SALE: A deposit of 10% of the sale price, cash or certified funds shall be required at the time of sale. The balance of the purchase price with interest at 6.00% per annum from the date of sale to the date of payment will be paid within TEN DAYS after the final ratification of the sale.Adjustments on all taxes, public charges and special or regular assessments will be made as of the date of sale and thereafter assumed by purchaser.If applicable, condominium and/or homeowners association dues and assessments that may become due after the time of sale will be the responsibility of the purchaser. Title examination, conveyancing, state revenue stamps, transfer taxes, title insurance, and all other costs incident to settlement are to be paid by the purchaser. Time is of the essence for the purchaser, otherwise the deposit will be forfeited and the property may be resold at risk and costs of the defaulting purchaser. If the sale is not ratified or if the Substitute Trustees are unable to convey marketable title in accord with these terms of sale, the purchaser's only remedy is the return of the deposit.
