Kinnamon, Jr. and Lynn W. Kinnamon, dated December 17, 2004 and recorded in Liber 583, folio 404 among the Land Records of Caroline County, MD, default having occurred under the terms thereof and at the request of the parties secured thereby, the undersigned Substitute Trustees will offer for sale at public auction at the Circuit Court for Caroline County, at the Court House Door, 109 Market St., Denton, MD 21629, on OCTOBER 17, 2023 AT 10:55 AM ALL THAT FEE SIMPLE LOT OF GROUND AND THE IMPROVEMENTS THEREON situated in Caroline County, Maryland and more fully described in the aforesaid Deed of Trust. The property is improved by a dwelling.The property, will be sold in an "as is" condition and subject to conditions, restrictions, easements, encumbrances and agreements of record affecting the subject property, if any, and with no warranty of any kind.Terms of Sale: A deposit in the form of cashier's or certified check, or in such other form as the Substitute Trustees may determine, at their sole discretion, for $6,000 at the time of sale. If the noteholder and/or servicer is the successful bidder, the deposit requirement is waived. Balance of the purchase price is to be paid within ten (10) days of the final ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Caroline County, Maryland. Interest is to be paid on the unpaid purchase price at the rate of 10.5% per annum from date of sale to the date the funds are received in the office of the Substitute Trustees, if the property is purchased by an entity other than the noteholder and/or servicer. If payment of the balance does not occur within ten (10) days of ratification, the deposit will be forfeited as liquidated damages. The purchaser agrees that the property may be resold pursuant to an order of court, waives personal service upon themselves and/or any principal or corporate designee of any documents filed regarding the failure to pay the purchase price within ten (10) days of ratification and expressly agrees to accept service by first class mail of said documents at the address provided by the purchaser in the Memorandum of Sale. The purchaser will not be entitled to any surplus or profits arising from the resale even if they are the result of improvements made by the purchaser. There will be no abatement of interest due from the purchaser in the event settlement is delayed for any reason. Taxes, ground rent, water rent, and all other public charges and assessments payable on an annual basis, including sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges, and front foot benefit charges, if applicable, to be adjusted for the current year to the date of sale, and assumed thereafter by the purchaser. Condominium fees and/or homeowners association dues, if any, shall be assumed by the purchaser from the date of sale. The purchaser shall be responsible for the payment of the ground rent escrow, if required. Cost of all documentary stamps, transfer taxes (including agricultural transfer taxes, if applicable), and all settlement charges shall be borne by the purchaser. The sale is subject to a post sale audit of the loan, including but not limited to an analysis of whether the borrower entered into a loan modification agreement, filed bankruptcy, reinstated or paid off the loan prior to the sale. The Substitute Trustees will convey either insurable or marketable title. If the Substitute Trustees are unable to convey insurable or marketable title or, the post sale audit concludes that the sale should not have occurred, or the sale is not ratified by the court for any reason, the purchaser's sole remedy in law or equity shall be limited to the refund of the deposit without interest even if the purchaser has made improvements to the property. Upon refund of the deposit, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Substitute Trustees. Purchaser shall be responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property. The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the property immediately after the sale. (Matter #22-601645).Laura H. G. TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE FOR THE PURCHASER.Adjustment of all real property taxes, including agricultural taxes, if applicable, and any and all public and/or private charges or assessments, to the extent such amounts survive foreclosure sale, including water/sewer, ground rent and front foot benefit charges, to be adjusted to date of sale and thereafter assumed by purchaser. Purchaser is responsible for any recapture of homestead tax credit. All transfer taxes and recordation taxes shall be paid by Purchaser. The purchaser shall be responsible for the payment of the ground rent escrow, if required. Condominium fees and/or homeowners association dues, if any, shall be assumed by the purchaser from the date of sale. Purchaser is responsible for obtaining physical possession of the property, and assumes risk of loss or damage to the property from the date of sale. The sale is subject to post-sale audit of the status of the loan with the loan servicer including, but not limited to, determination of whether the borrower entered into any repayment agreement, reinstated or paid off the loan prior to the sale. In any such event, this sale shall be null and void, and the Purchaser's sole remedy, in law or equity, shall be the return of the deposit without interest.If purchaser fails to settle within ten days of ratification, subject to order of court, purchaser agrees that property will be resold and entire deposit retained by Sub. Trustees as liquidated damages for all losses occasioned by the purchaser's default and purchaser shall have no further liability. The purchaser waives personal service of any papers filed in connection with its failure to settle within ten days of ratification and expressly agrees to accept service by first class mail at the address provided by the Purchaser as identified on the Memorandum of Sale. The defaulted purchaser shall not be entitled to any surplus proceeds resulting from said resale even if such surplus results from improvements to the property by said defaulted purchaser. Sub. Trustees will convey either marketable or insurable title. If they cannot deliver one or the other, or if ratification of the sale is denied by the Circuit Court for any reason, the Purchaser's sole remedy, at law or equity, is return of the deposit without interest. title: Legal Notices
content:
Legal Notices

 Page: 27 | Section: Legal Notices

 Words 

 Read News Document

 TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that Resolution No. 349, A RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE OFFICIAL ROAD NAME LIST FOR TALBOT COUNTY TO CHANGE THE NAMES OF "LINCOLN ROAD" AND "SHELLMILL AVENUE" TO "BELLEVUE SCHOOL ROAD" AND "TURNER AVENUE", RESPECTIVELY, IN THE VILLAGE OF BELLEVUE, TALBOT COUNTY, MARYLAND, PURSUANT TO § 131-5(C) OF THE TALBOT COUNTY CODE, was enacted by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, October 10, 2023.The legislation will become effective immediately.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3036905 SD 10/13/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that Resolution No. 345, A RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE TALBOT COUNTY COMPREHENSIVE WATER AND SEWER PLAN FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADDING OR MODIFYING THE TALBOT COUNTY CAPITAL PROJECT FOR FISCAL YEARS 2024 AND 2025 TO ADD A NEW CAPITAL PROJECT IN THE AMOUNT OF $12.0 MILLION FOR THE PURPOSE OF REPLACING AND/OR REHABILITATING THE TOWN OF EASTON SEWER COLLECTION SYSTEM TO MITIGATE INFLOW AND INFILTRATION, was enacted by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, October 10, 2023.The legislation will become effective immediately.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3036907 SD 10/13/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that the public hearings scheduled for Tuesday, October 24, 2023 on:· Resolution No. 338, A RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE TALBOT COUNTY COMPREHENSIVE WATER AND SEWER PLAN (CWSP) FOR CONSISTENCY WITH DISCHARGE PERMIT NO. 19-DP-3460, ISSUED BY THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT ON OCTOBER 27, 2022 AND TO REQUIRE THAT ANY FUTURE EXPANSION OF THE NEW LAKESIDE WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT SHALL REQUIRE AN AMENDMENT TO THE CWSP· Resolution No. 347, A RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE TALBOT COUNTY COMPREHENSIVE WATER AND SEWER PLAN TO PROVIDE THE EQUIVALENT DWELLING UNITS FOR ALL PHASES OF THE LAKESIDE DEVELOPMENT and· Resolution No. 348, A RESOLUTION REGARDING THE TALBOT COUNTY COMPREHENSIVE WATER AND SEWER PLAN TO CLARIFY AND CONFIRM THE WATER AND SEWER CLASSIFICATIONS OF CERTAIN PARCELS INCORRECTLY SHOWN IN EXHIBITS A AND B TO RESOLUTION NO. 281, AS AMENDED are hereby POSTPONED.Individuals interested in obtaining a copy of the Resolutions may contact the Office of the County Manager during regular office hours. The Resolutions are also posted on the County's website at www.talbotcountymd.gov.All interested parties are hereby notified.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3036910 SD 10/13/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that a public hearing will be held by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, November 14, 2023 at 6:30 p.m. in the Bradley Meeting Room, South Wing, Talbot County Courthouse, 11 North Washington St., Easton, Maryland 21601 for consideration of Bill No. 1549, AN EMERGENCY BILL TO AMEND BILL NOS. 1244 AND 1479 FOR THE PURPOSE OF EXPANDING THE SCOPE OF WORK OF THE CAPITAL PROJECT TO REPLACE THE ROOF OF THE SOUTH WING OF THE TALBOT COUNTY COURTHOUSE TO ALSO INCLUDE REPLACING THE ROOF OF THE NORTH WING OF THE TALBOT COUNTY COURTHOUSE WITHOUT INCREASING THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE APPROPRIATION THEREFOR.The public is encouraged to submit written comments on Bill No. 1549 to PublicComment@talbotcountymd.gov by Noon on Wednesday, November 8, 2023. Comments submitted will be made a part of the public record.Individuals interested in obtaining a copy of the Bill may contact the Office of the County Manager during regular office hours. The Bill is also posted on the County's website at www.talbotcountymd.gov. If you require communications assistance, please contact the County Manager's Office at (410) 770-8010 or TTY (410) 822-8735 by Monday, November 13, 2023.All interested parties are hereby notified and invited to comment.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3036908 SD 10/13,10/20/2023TOWN OF HURLOCK PUBLIC NOTICE ELECTIONS There will be an Election for the District 4 Council seat Saturday, November 4, 2023 at the Hurlock Elementary School Cafeteria, 301 Charles Street.The Polls will be open from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.THE DEADLINE FOR CLOSE OF VOTER REGISTRATION, ADDRESS AND NAME CHANGES is Friday October 13, 2023 AT 4:00PM.Voters may pick up a voter registration form at the Hurlock Town Office or the Dorchester Board of Elections Office.Registered voters may vote by absentee ballot if unable to vote in person. Absentee Ballot Applications are available at the Hurlock Town Office or the Dorchester Board of Elections.Completed forms can be mailed or hand delivered to the Hurlock Town Office or the Dorchester Board of Elections by close of business Monday October 30, 2023.Completed applications may be faxed to 410-228-9635 until 9:00 P.M. Monday October 30, 2023.Late absentee applications and ballots can be accepted until 6:00PM on Election Day at the Dorchester County Board of Elections at 501 Court Lane, Cambridge, MD 21613.If you require assistance, you may call The Hurlock Town Office, 410-943-4181, or the Dorchester Board of Elections, 410-228-2560.John Avery Hurlock Town Manager 3036822 SD 10/13,10/20/2023Spring and Associates Inc. is requesting bids from WBE and MBE contractors for construction, services, equipment and supplies for the Talbot County Resolution 250-Region II Sewer System.To obtain bid documents please use the following website: https://talbotcountysewer250.com/category/documents Please submit bids to our office by COB October 17,2023.410-822-0485.3036889 SD 0/113/2023TALBOT COUNTY PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that Resolution No. 346, A RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE TALBOT COUNTY COMPREHENSIVE WATER AND SEWER PLAN FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADDING OR MODIFYING THE TALBOT COUNTY CAPITAL PROJECT FOR FISCAL YEARS 2024 AND 2025 TO ADD A NEW CAPITAL PROJECT IN THE AMOUNT OF $8.0 MILLION FOR THE PURPOSE OF REPLACING AND/OR REHABILITATING THE REGION V (TILGHMAN) SEWER COLLECTION SYSTEM TO MITIGATE INFLOW AND INFILTRATION, was enacted by the County Council of Talbot County on Tuesday, October 10, 2023.The legislation will become effective immediately.COUNTY COUNCIL OF TALBOT COUNTY 3036906 SD 10/13/2023IN THE CIRCUIT COURT FOR DORCHESTER COUNTY, MARYLAND Civil Action No. C-09-CV-22-000235 STEPHEN B. JACKSON and STEVEN P. HENNE Substituted Trustees Plaintiffs v.ROY K. NEWMAN Defendant NOTICE NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN, this 10th day of October, 2023, by the Circuit Court for Dorchester County, Maryland, that the sale of the property which is the subject of these proceedings, made by Stephen B. Jackson and Steven P. Henne, Substituted Trustees, to: The Department of Housing and Community Development for the State of Maryland and reported in the above-entitled cause, will be ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary thereof be shown on or before the 9th day of November, 2023, provided a copy of this Notice be inserted in a newspaper published in said Dorchester County, Maryland, once a week for three successive weeks on or before the 9th day of November, 2023.The Report of Sale states the amount of the foreclosure sale price to be $137,200.00. The property sold herein is known as 2618 Toddville Road, Toddville, Maryland 21672.Amy J. Craig/SD Clerk of the Circuit Court for Dorchester County, Maryland 3036892 SD 10/13,10/20,10/27/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT WATER AND SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION Notice of Application Received for State Permit Issue Date: October 13, 2023 in The Dorchester Star The Water and Science Administration (Administration) is reviewing the application for the State Permit listed below. The application and related information are on file with the Administration at the main office; arrangements may be made for inspection and copying. Opportunity is afforded for individuals to provide written comments or to be placed on an interested persons list for the listed application. Any further notices about actions on an application will be provided only by mail to those individuals on a mailing list of interested persons. Comments must be received in writing by the Administration on or before February 15, 2023.All inquiries and requests should include the permit application number; your name, address and telephone number; and should be addressed to Robert Peoples, Chief, Source Protection and Water Appropriation Division, Water and Science Administration, 1800 Washington Blvd, Baltimore, Maryland 21230. Telephone: (410) 537-3590.Dorchester County DO2023G002/01 - Hilmar Helgason, 5435 Cokesbury Road, Rhodesdale, Maryland has applied to appropriate and use an annual average of 29,900 gallons of groundwater per day (gpd) and an average during the month of maximum use of 195,300 gpd. The water will be used for crop irrigation. Water will be withdrawn from one well in the Columbia aquifer. The project is located at 6554 Eldorado Road, Federalsburg, Dorchester County, Maryland.The irrigation well is constructed to a depth of 80 feet. Impacts to the resource and nearby users were evaluated using aquifer data from geologic reports available to the Administration. In making the evaluation, the withdrawal was modeled as being pumped continuously for 60 days at the maximum rate with no recharge to the aquifer. Pumping during periods of maximum use may lower the water table less than 1.5 feet at a distance of 200 feet from the nearest property line. Changes in water levels decrease at greater distances. No unreasonable impacts to the Columbia aquifer or other users of the Columbia aquifer are expected.3036217 SD 10/13/2023

title: PET OF THE WEEK
content:
PET OF THE WEEK

 October 17, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: 2 | Section: News 
 
 109
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Caption: TALBOT HUMANE
 
Asher is a 2-year-old domestic short hair. She is a spayed female who arrived at the shelter on Sept. 22. Asher is a gorgeous cat who wants nothing more than to explore the great outdoors and be outside. She was adopted before, but returned because she just refuses to use a litterbox. Who can blame her when the world was once her litterbox?! Asher is super friendly and will love to have your company in the garden or out in the yard. She is an excellent hunter and will keep your yard pest free while she is at it. Adopt Asher today by calling Talbot Humane, 410-822-0107 or email info@talbothumane.org. 

 © Copyright © 2023 Star Democrat, Chesapeake Publishing Group (Adams Publishing/APGMedia). All rights reserved.

llm_classification.explanation: The article is a public notice announcing a pet adoption opportunity. While it mentions a shelter and animal care, the primary purpose is to disseminate information about an adoption, aligning most directly with 'Public Notices.' 'Local Life' is a secondary fit due to community-focused content, but the core nature of the text is an official announcement.

Phelps Register of Wills for Caroline County 109 Market St., Courthouse, Room 119 Denton, MD 21629 3035774 TR 10/4,10/11,10/18/2023 MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT AIR AND RADIATION ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF APPLICATION AND OPPORTUNITY TO REQUEST AN INFORMATIONAL MEETING The Maryland Department of the Environment, Air and Radiation Administration (ARA) received a permit-to-construct application from Culpeper of Federalsburg on February 16, 2023, for the installation of one (1) 34' x 64' double track kiln with a direct natural gas fired burner system.The proposed installation will be located at 2000 Industrial Park Road, Federalsburg, MD 21632.In accordance with HB 1200/Ch. 588 of 2022, the applicant provided an environmental justice (EJ) Score for the census tract in which the project is located using the Maryland EJ mapping tool. The EJ Score, expressed as a statewide percentile, was shown to be 66.38 which the Department has verified. This score considers three demographic indicators - minority population above 50%, poverty rate above 25% and limited English proficiency above 15%.Copies of the application, the EJ mapping tool screening report (which includes the score), and other supporting documents are available for public inspection on the Department's website at https://mde.maryland.gov/programs/Permits/AirManagementPermits/Pages/index.aspx (click on Docket Number 11-23. Any applicant-provided information regarding a description of the environmental and socioeconomic indicators contributing to that EJ score can also be found at the listed website. Such information has not yet been reviewed by the Department.A review of the submitted information will be conducted when the Department undertakes its technical review of all documents included in the application.Pursuant to the Environment Article, Section 1-603, Annotated Code of Maryland, the Department will hold an informational meeting to discuss the application and the permit review process if the Department receives a written request for a meeting within 10 working days from the date of the second publication of this notice. A requested informational meeting will be held virtually using teleconference or internet-based conferencing technology unless a specific request for an in-person informational meeting is received. All requests for an informational meeting should be directed to the attention of Ms. Shannon Heafey, Air Quality Permits Program by email to Shannon.heafey@maryland.gov or by mail to the Air and Radiation Administration, 1800 Washington Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21230. Further information may be obtained by calling Ms. Shannon Heafey at 410-537-4433.Christopher R. Hoagland, Director Air and Radiation Administration 3036925 TR 10/18,10/25/2023 SMALL ESTATE NOTICE OF APPOINTMENT NOTICE TO CREDITORS NOTICE TO UNKNOWN HEIRS Estate No. 11191 TO ALL PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE ESTATE OF DAWN MARIE ALLEN Notice is given that MARK WAYNE ALLEN SR., 17042 DELP DRIVE, HENDERSON, MD 21640 was on OCTOBER 10, 2023 appointed personal representative of the small estate of DAWN MARIE ALLEN, who died on OCTOBER 2, 2023 without a will.Further information can be obtained by reviewing the estate file in the office of the Register of Wills or by contacting the personal representative or the attorney.All persons having any objection to the appointment shall file their objections with the Register of Wills within 30 days after the date of publication of this Notice. Atkinson 409 Railroad Ave RoofM. Coughlan 104 N. Talbot Stairs3038641 SD 11/2/2023PUBLIC NOTICEMARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES FISHING AND BOATING SERVICESProposed Regulation Open for Comment ¯ DNR Ski Sticker Approved Vessel List The Secretary of Natural Resources proposes to amend Regulation.02 under COMAR 08.04.16 DNR Ski Sticker. The purpose of this action is to update the list of registered vessels that may request a DNR Ski Sticker. The current regulation includes a list of qualified vessels and permits the Department to issue a DNR Ski Sticker to owners of a registered qualified vessel. Comments concerning this regulation will be accepted through November 20, 2023. Please visit the Boating Regulations webpage for all information at https://dnr.maryland.gov/boating/Pages/regulations/changes boating.aspx#hssval Josh Kurtz Secretary of Natural Resources 3038572 SD 11/2/2023

While there are elements of local government and environmental regulations, the primary context is formal public announcements.

Phelps Register of Wills for Caroline County 109 Market Street, Courthouse, Room 119 Denton, MD 21629 3039056 TR 11/8/2023Notice of Application for State Wetland Licenses, Private Wetland Permits, Nontidal Wetlands and Waterways Permits and/or Water Quality Certification and the Opportunity to Provide Written Comment or Request an Informational Hearing The Water and Science Administration is reviewing the following applications for State Wetland Licenses, Private Wetland Permits, Nontidal Wetlands and Waterways Permits and/or Water Quality Certifications. The applications and related information are on file at the Administration. Arrangements may be made for inspection and copying of file materials. Interested parties may provide written comments on the application or request an informational hearing on any listed application. A request for a hearing must be in writing and provide the following information: 1) Name, Address, and Telephone Number of the person making the request; 2) The identity of any other person(s) the requestor is representing; and 3) the specific issues proposed to be considered at the hearing. Please refer to the case number (i.e., 00-NT-0000, 00-WL-000, 00-WP-000, 00-WQC-0000) which identifies each application. Address correspondence to the attention of the Administration contact contained in the project's public notice. If none is listed, send correspondence to the Wetlands and Waterways Program, Water and Science Administration, 1800 Washington Boulevard Baltimore, Maryland, 21230. For questions regarding any public notice, you can contact the Wetlands and Waterways Program by Telephone; (410) 537-3751. Written comments or requests for a hearing must be received on or before December 1, 2023 unless otherwise noted in the Public Notice.Caroline County 22-WL-0878/THE CAROLINE COUNTY COMMISSIONERS, C/O Mark Lasocha, 107 S. Fourth Street, Denton, Maryland 21629, have applied to construct 885 linear feet of 2-foot-wide replacement wave screen 18-inches channelward of the existing wave screen; construct an 85-foot long by 8-foot wide floating fuel dock connecting to a 228-foot long by 8-foot wide floating pier, two 50-foot long by 4-foot wide finger piers, one 40-foot long by 4-foot wide finger pier, three 30-foot long by 4-foot wide finger piers, and 17 mooring piles; to construct a 24-foot long by 6-foot wide aluminum gangway connecting to a 239-foot long by 8-foot wide floating pier with six 40-foot long by 4-foot wide finger piers, seven 30-foot long by 4-foot wide finger piers, a 68-foot long by 6-foot wide T-head platform, and 30 mooring piles; to construct a 24-foot long by 6-foot wide aluminum gangway connecting to a 235-foot long by 8-foot wide floating pier with fourteen 30-foot long by 4-foot wide finger piers, a 68-foot long by 6-foot wide T-head platform, and 32 mooring piles; to construct a replacement 610-foot long by 8-foot wide L-shaped fishing pier, all to extend no more than 357 feet channelward of the bulkhead; and to hydraulically maintenance dredge a 380-foot long by 355-foot wide area (140,383 square foot area) to-6.0 feet mean low water resulting in a total of approximately 9,150 cubic yards of dredge material to be deposited at an approved upland disposal site located at 2715 Poplar Neck Road, Preston, Maryland. The purpose of this project is to upgrade an existing marina. The project is located on the Choptank River at 21843 Water Street, Preston, Caroline County, Maryland. For more information, contact Mary Phipps-Dickerson at mary.phipps-dickerson@maryland.gov or (443) 509-0797.3038894 TR 1 1/8/2023ANNE C. Belt to the trustees for the benefit of the holder of the indebtedness (the "Noteholder"), recorded among the Land Records of Queen Anne's County, Maryland, in Liber 3543, folio 143 (the "Purchase Money Deed of Trust"); the Noteholder having subsequently appointed Bob Van Galoubandi, Substitute Trustee (the "Trustee"), under the Purchase Money Deed of Trust pursuant to a Deed of Appointment of Substitute Trustee, dated August 26, 2023, duly executed, acknowledged, and recorded among the Land Records of Queen Anne's County, Maryland, in Liber 4281, folio 152, default having occurred under the terms of said Purchase Money Deed of Trust and at the request of the Noteholder, the Trustee will offer for sale to the highest qualified bidder at a public auction, in Front of the Circuit Court for Queen Anne's County, 200 N Commerce Street, Centreville, Maryland 21617, on: November 24, 2023 at 11:00 AM THAT CERTAIN real property and any improvements thereon described in the Deed of Trust and being situate in Queen Anne's County, Maryland (the "Property"), as follows: Tax Parcel 237 N/F Lands of James Edward Fisher, Jr. Deed MWM 260, 652 on a Plat entitled "Boundary Line Agreement Plan on the Lands of Tax Map 58H, Parcel 237 & Tax Map 58H, Parcel 238, James Edward Fisher, Jr. & James E. & Sharon Keene, Fifth Election District, Queen Anne's County, Maryland" prepared by McCrone Engineers, Surveyors and Planners, dated October 2020 and recorded among the Plat Records of Queen Anne's County, Maryland in Plat Book K.B.H. 49, Page 35.Being the same property conveyed to James Edward Fisher, Jr. by virtue of Deed from Annie Whittico Turner dated September 15, 1986, in Liber MWM No. 260, folio 652.Tax Acct No. 05-018781 TERMS OF SALE: A deposit in the amount of ($10,000.00), payable in cash, certified check or other form acceptable to the Trustee, will be required of the purchaser at the time and place of the sale for the Property. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in cash or by certified check with interest on the unpaid balance of the purchase price at the rate of (10.00%) per annum from the date of sale to and including the date of settlement. In the event the Noteholder, its servicer or an affiliate, or assignee of any one of them, is the purchaser, such party will not be required to make a deposit or to pay interest on the unpaid purchase money. Taxes, water rent and all other municipal charges and liens owed against the Property (if any) shall be the responsibility of the purchaser and shall be paid by the purchaser at settlement. In addition, all other charges, expenses and liens owed against the Property including, but not limited to, all condominium fees, HOA fees, and expenses and public charges and assessments owed against the Property and payable on a periodic basis, such as sanitary and/or metropolitan district charges (if any) shall also be the responsibility of the purchaser and shall be paid by the purchaser at settlement. The Trustee reserves the right to reject any and all bids, and to extend the time for settlement, if applicable.The Property will be sold in "AS IS" condition and without any warranties or representations, either express or implied, as to the nature, condition or description of the improvements. In addition, the Property will also be sold subject to all existing housing, building and zoning code violations, subject to all critical area and wetland violations, subject to all environmental problems and violations which may exist on or with respect to the Property, and subject to all matters and restrictions of record affecting the same (if any). The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the above-referenced Property immediately after the sale takes place. It shall be the purchaser's responsibility to obtain possession of the Property following ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Queen Anne's County.The Property will be sold subject to all easements, conditions, ground leases, senior liens, taxes, restrictions, rights of redemption, covenants, encumbrances, agreements, and unexpired leases of record, and such state of facts that an accurate survey or physical inspection of the Property might disclose (if any) that are not otherwise extinguished by operation of law.The purchaser shall pay all state and local transfer taxes, recordation taxes and fees, title examination costs, attorneys' fees, conveyance fees and all other incidental settlement costs. The purchaser shall settle and comply with the sale terms within twenty (20) days following the final ratification of sale by the Circuit Court for Queen Anne's County, unless said period is extended by the Trustee for good cause shown. T ime is of the essence. Settlement shall be held at the office of the Trustee.In the event the purchaser fails to go to settlement as required, subject to order of court, purchaser agrees that property will be resold and entire deposit retained by the Trustee as liquidated damages for all losses occasioned by the purchaser's default and purchaser shall have no further liability. The defaulted purchaser shall not be entitled to any surplus proceeds resulting from said resale even if such surplus results from improvements to the property by said defaulted purchaser.If the Trustee is unable to convey the Property as described above, the purchaser's sole remedy at law or in equity shall be limited to the refund of the aforementioned deposit, without interest thereon.Upon refund of the deposit to the purchaser, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Trustee or the Noteholder.The information contained herein is offered for informational purposes only. title: Brighter Christmas Fund - CARING & SHARING
content:
Brighter Christmas Fund - CARING & SHARING

 November 15, 2023 | Star Democrat, The (Easton, MD)

 Page: 4A | Section: News 
 
 231
 Words 

 Read News Document

 Families needing assistance are urged to apply as soon as possible. To be eligible for assistance, youmust be a resident of Caroline, Dorchester, Kent, Queen Anne's or Talbot counties.If you receive assistance from social services, you must apply through your agency.If you do not receive assistance from social services, applications can be picked up in the lobby at The Star Democrat's office, located at 29088 Airpark Dr, Easton.Youmust submit with your application: · Copies of Social Securitycards for adults and children on application · Proof ofhomeaddress (copyofutilitybill, rent or mortgage payment inyour name) · Proof of income(copyof 2022 incometax returnand/or last twopay stubs).Return the completed application no later than 3 pm, December 1.Eligible families may receive a shopping voucher for $100 per child, with a $300 maximum per family, to be redeemed at their local Walmart. Shopping must be done by Sunday, December 31. A total of $100,000 will be given out for this year's Brighter Christmas Fund, so families are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.Families may receive assistance from the Brighter Christmas Fund for up to three consecutive years. Families that have received funds from the program for three years in a row must wait one year before they are eligible to reapply.Brighter Christmas Fund awards are dependent on donations from the community.Filling out an application does not guarantee that you will receive anything. 

 © Copyright © 2023 Star Democrat, Chesapeake Publishing Group (Adams Publishing/APGMedia). All rights reserved.

llm_classification.explanation: The article is a public announcement about a charitable fund application process, which aligns with 'Public Notices' as it disseminates information about a community initiative. While 'Local Life' could be considered due to its community focus, the primary nature of the content is an official notice rather than general community news.

Lord, Clerk 3038270 TR 11/1,11/8,11/15/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT AIR AND RADIATION ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF APPLICATION AND INFORMATIONAL MEETING The Maryland Department of the Environment, Air and Radiation Administration (ARA) received a permit-to-construct application from Culpeper of Federalsburg on February 16, 2023, for the installation of one (1) 34' x 64' double track kiln with a direct natural gas fired burner system.The proposed installation will be located at 2000 Industrial Park Drive, Federalsburg, MD 21632.In accordance with HB 1200/Ch. 588 of 2022, the applicant provided an environmental justice (EJ) Score for the census tract in which the project is located using the Maryland EJ mapping tool. The EJ Score, expressed as a statewide percentile, was shown to be 66.38 which the Department has verified. This score considers three demographic indicators - minority population above 50%, poverty rate above 25% and limited English proficiency above 15%.Copies of the application, the EJ mapping tool screening report (which includes the score), and other supporting documents are available for public inspection on the Department's website at https://mde.maryland. gov/programs/Permits/AirManagementPermits/Pages/index.aspx (click on Docket Number 11-23). Any applicant-provided information regarding a description of the environmental and socioeconomic indicators contributing to that EJ score can also be found at the listed website. Such information has not yet been reviewed by the Department.A review of the submitted information will be conducted when the Department undertakes its technical review of all documents included in the application.Pursuant to the Environment Article, Section 1-603, Annotated Code of Maryland, an Informational Meeting has been scheduled so that citizens can discuss the application and the permit review process with the applicant and the Department.A community informational meeting has been scheduled so that citizens can discuss the application and the permit with the applicant and the Department. The community informational meeting will be held virtually on November 28, 2023 at 6:30 p.m.To attend the meeting, please register using the following link no later than November 27, 2023: https://forms.gle/9xtRc2Bx4No3k27h7 Registered attendees will receive instructions on how to join the virtual meeting using a computer and internet connection or telephone.The Department will provide an interpreter for deaf and hearing impaired persons provided that a request is made for such service at least ten (10) days prior to the meeting. Further information may be obtained by calling Ms. Shannon Heafey at 410-537-4433.Christopher R. Hoagland, Director Air and Radiation Administration 3039701 TR 11/15,11/22/2023JAMES T. In the event the Noteholder, its servicer or an affiliate, or assignee of any one of them, is the purchaser, such party will not be required to make a deposit or to pay interest on the unpaid purchase money. In addition, the Property will also be sold subject to all existing housing, building and zoning code violations, subject to all critical area and wetland violations, subject to all environmental problems and violations which may exist on or with respect to the Property, and subject to all matters and restrictions of record affecting the same (if any). The purchaser at the foreclosure sale shall assume the risk of loss for the above-referenced Property immediately after the sale takes place. It shall be the purchaser's responsibility to obtain possession of the Property following ratification of the sale by the Circuit Court for Queen Anne's County.The Property will be sold subject to all easements, conditions, ground leases, senior liens, taxes, restrictions, rights of redemption, covenants, encumbrances, agreements, and unexpired leases of record, and such state of facts that an accurate survey or physical inspection of the Property might disclose (if any) that are not otherwise extinguished by operation of law.The purchaser shall pay all state and local transfer taxes, recordation taxes and fees, title examination costs, attorneys' fees, conveyance fees and all other incidental settlement costs. The purchaser shall settle and comply with the sale terms within twenty (20) days following the final ratification of sale by the Circuit Court for Queen Anne's County, unless said period is extended by the Trustee for good cause shown. T ime is of the essence. Settlement shall be held at the office of the Trustee.In the event the purchaser fails to go to settlement as required, subject to order of court, purchaser agrees that property will be resold and entire deposit retained by the Trustee as liquidated damages for all losses occasioned by the purchaser's default and purchaser shall have no further liability. The defaulted purchaser shall not be entitled to any surplus proceeds resulting from said resale even if such surplus results from improvements to the property by said defaulted purchaser.If the Trustee is unable to convey the Property as described above, the purchaser's sole remedy at law or in equity shall be limited to the refund of the aforementioned deposit, without interest thereon.Upon refund of the deposit to the purchaser, the sale shall be void and of no effect, and the purchaser shall have no further claim against the Trustee or the Noteholder.The information contained herein is offered for informational purposes only. llm_classification.explanation: The article consists entirely of legal and public notices, including court proceedings, estate appointments, property sales, and official hearings. While 'Public Notices' is an explicit category, related topics like 'Local Government' and 'Legal' are also relevant but less specific.

title: Legal Notices
content:
Legal Notices

 Page: 5A | Section: Legal Notices

 IN THE CIRCUIT COURT FOR CAROLINE COUNTY, MARYLAND Case No. C-05-CV-22-000094 DAVID WILLIAMSON, et al, Substitute Trustee, Plaintiff, v.DOUGLAS A RIDDLEBERGER, et al, Defendants.NOTICE Notice is hereby issued this 17th day of November, 2023, that the sale of the property in this case, 25899 BROOKWOOD ROAD, GREENSBORO MD 21639, reported by Jennifer Deardorff, Attorney for the Substitute Trustee, be ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary be shown on or before the 18th day of December, 2023, provided a copy of this Notice be inserted in Times Record, a newspaper published in CAROLINE County, Maryland, once in each of three (3) successive weeks on or before the 11th day of December, 2023.The report states the amount of sale to be $231,073.25.Terry B. A claim not presented or filed on or before that date, or any extension provided by law, is unenforceable thereafter. Phelps Register of Wills for Caroline County 109 Market St., Courthouse, Room 119 Denton, MD 21629 3040269 TR 11/22,11/29,12/6/2023NOTICE OF PUBLIC SALE OF PERSONAL PROPERTY Notice is hereby given that the undersigned will sell to satisfy the lien of the owner at public sale by competitive bidding on Tuesday November 28, 2023 at 9:00 a.m. at: Harmony Road Self Storage, LLC 8847 Harmony Road Denton, MD 21629 443.448.4109 The personal goods stored therein by the below named occupant: Unit A10 - Patricia LundgrenUnit C17 - Steven BelloUnit E28 - Brian FisherUnit F25 - Stanford Ricks3040212 TR 11/22,11/29/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT WATER AND SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF TENTATIVE DETERMINATION Caroline CountyApplication for State Discharge Permit 20DP0595, NPDES Permit MD0020249: The Town of Federalsburg, 118 North Main Street, Federalsburg, Maryland 21632, has applied for a permit renewal to discharge treated wastewater, at the average rate of 750,000 gallons per day (gpd), from the Federalsburg Wastewater Treatment Plant, located at 125 Kerney Street, Federalsburg, Maryland 21632. Outfall 001A discharges into Marshyhope Creek, designated as Use I waters (protected for water contact recreation and nontidal warm water aquatic life).The Maryland Department of the Environment has made a tentative determination to reissue the discharge permit with the following proposed limitations and conditions: BOD5, 20 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 30 mg/L maximum weekly arithmetic mean (5/1 to 10/31), and 30 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 45 mg/L maximum weekly arithmetic mean (11/1 to 4/30); Percent Removal of BOD5, 85% minimum monthly arithmetic mean; Total Suspended Solids (TSS), 30 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean, 45 mg/L maximum weekly arithmetic mean, and 68,525 lbs/yr maximum annual load; Percent Removal of TSS, 85% minimum monthly arithmetic mean; Total Ammonia Nitrogen, Interim limit: 7.6 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean (5/1 to 10/31), and Final limit: 3.1 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean (5/1 to 10/31); Total Phosphorus as P (TP), 0.72 mg/L maximum monthly arithmetic mean (5/1 - 10/31), 135 lbs/mo. maximum monthly load (5/1 - 10/31), and 685 lbs/year maximum annual load; Total Nitrogen as N (TN), 9,137 lbs/year maximum annual load; Total Residual Chlorine, less than 0.10 mg/L (non-detectable level); Enterococci, 35 MPN/100mL maximum monthly geometric mean; pH maintained between 6.5 and 8.5; and Dissolved Oxygen, 5.0 mg/L minimum at any time.TSS, TN, and TP limits are in conformance with the Chesapeake Bay TMDL, approved on 12/29/2010. Regular effluent monitoring and reporting is required.If a written request is received by December 12, 2023, a public hearing on the tentative determination for this application can be scheduled.The request should be sent to the Maryland Department of the Environment, Water and Science Administration, 1800 Washington Blvd., Baltimore, Maryland 21230-1708, Attn.: Yen-Der Cheng, Chief, Municipal Permits Division and must include the name, address and telephone number (home and work) of the person making the request, the name of any other party whom the person making the request may represent, and the name of the facility and permit number.Failure to request a hearing by December 12, 2023 will constitute a waiver of the right to a public hearing on the tentative determination for this permit.Written comments concerning the tentative determination will be considered in the preparation of a final determination if submitted to the Department, to the attention of Yen-Der Cheng at the above address, on or before December 22, 2023. Any hearing-impaired person who requests a hearing may request an interpreter at the hearing by contacting Mr. Cheng at (410) 537-3363 or 1-800-633-6101, or by written request to the above address at least ten working days prior to the scheduled hearing date.Information supporting the tentative determination, including the draft permit and fact sheet, may be reviewed by contacting Mr. Cheng at the above telephone number to make an appointment or by written request to Mr. Cheng at the above address. Copies of documents may be obtained at a cost of $0.36 per page.3040255 TR 11/22,11/29/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT WATER AND SCIENCE ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF TENTATIVE DETERMINATIONCaroline CountyApplication for State Discharge Permit 22DP1455, NPDES Permit MD0055522: Caroline County Board of Education, Support Services, 11348 Greensboro Road, Denton, Maryland 21629, applied for renewal of the permit to discharge an average of 11,000 gallons per day (gpd) of treated domestic wastewater from the Colonel Richardson Middle & High School Wastewater Treatment Plant located at 25390 Richardson Road, Federalsburg.Caroline County, Maryland 21632 to an unnamed tributary of Tull Branch, which is designated as Use I waters, protected for water contact recreation and nontidal warmwater aquatic life.The Department is proposing to reissue the discharge permit for the facility with the following effluent limitations for the flow of 11,000 gpd: BOD5, 3.0 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 4.5 mg/l maximum weekly arithmetic mean from May 1 through October 31, 30 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 45 mg/l maximum weekly arithmetic means during November 1 through April 30 and minimum 85% monthly average removal; Total suspended solids, 30 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean, 45 mg/l maximum weekly arithmetic mean and minimum 85% monthly average removal; Total Kjeldahl nitrogen-N, 3.0 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 4.5 mg/l maximum weekly arithmetic mean during May 1 through October 31 only; Interim Ammonia-N limit of 1.0 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 5.7 mg/l maximum daily arithmetic mean during May 1 through October 31 and 1.7 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 5.7 mg/l maximum daily arithmetic mean during November 1 through April 30. Final Ammonia limit of 0.52 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 2.3 mg/l maximum daily arithmetic mean from May 1 through October 31 and 1.2 mg/l maximum monthly arithmetic mean and 5.6 mg/l maximum daily arithmetic mean during November 1 through April 30, go into effect 18 months after the Effective Date of this Discharge Permit; Total phosphorus, 10 lbs/month maximum monthly load and 3.72 mg/l maximum monthly average concentration during May 1 through October 31 only; E.coli, 126 MPN/100 ml maximum monthly geometric mean concentration; Dissolved oxygen, 6.0 mg/l minimum at any time; pH maintained between 6.5 and 8.1; and if chlorine is used in any treatment process, Total residual chlorine of nondetectable level at any time.This permit is in conformance with the load allocation for segment NANOH (Upper Nanticoke River Oligohaline) in the "Chesapeake Bay TMDL for Nitrogen, Phosphorus, and Sediment" established on December 29, 2010.If a written request is received by December 12, 2023, a public hearing on the tentative determination for this application can be scheduled.The request should be sent to the Maryland Department of the Environment, Water and Science Administration, 1800 Washington Blvd., Baltimore, Maryland 21230-1708, Attn.: Yen-Der Cheng, Chief, Municipal Permits Division and must include the name, address and telephone number (home and work) of the person making the request, the name of any other party whom the person making the request may represent, and the name of the facility and permit number.Failure to request a hearing by December 12, 2023 will constitute a waiver of the right to a public hearing on the tentative determination for this permit.Written comments concerning the tentative determination will be considered in the preparation of a final determination if submitted to the Department, to the attention of Yen-Der Cheng at the above address, on or before December 22, 2023. Any hearing-impaired person who requests a hearing may request an interpreter at the hearing by contacting Mr. Cheng at (410) 537-3363 or 1-800-633-6101, or by written request to the above address at least ten working days prior to the scheduled hearing date.Information supporting the tentative determination, including the draft permit and fact sheet, may be reviewed by contacting Mr. Cheng at the above telephone number to make an appointment or by written request to Mr. Cheng at the above address. Copies of documents may be obtained at a cost of $0.36 per page.3040258 TR 11/22,11/29/2023JAMES T. WORM, III ESQ.5 N. Lord CLERK OF THE CIRCUIT COURT CAROLINE COUNTY, MARYLAND 3039490 TR 11/15,11/22,11/29/2023MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT AIR AND RADIATION ADMINISTRATION NOTICE OF APPLICATION AND INFORMATIONAL MEETING The Maryland Department of the Environment, Air and Radiation Administration (ARA) received a permit-to-construct application from Culpeper of Federalsburg on February 16, 2023, for the installation of one (1) 34' x 64' double track kiln with a direct natural gas fired burner system.The proposed installation will be located at 2000 Industrial Park Drive, Federalsburg, MD 21632.In accordance with HB 1200/Ch. 588 of 2022, the applicant provided an environmental justice (EJ) Score for the census tract in which the project is located using the Maryland EJ mapping tool. The EJ Score, expressed as a statewide percentile, was shown to be 66.38 which the Department has verified. This score considers three demographic indicators - minority population above 50%, poverty rate above 25% and limited English proficiency above 15%.Copies of the application, the EJ mapping tool screening report (which includes the score), and other supporting documents are available for public inspection on the Department's website at https://mde.maryland. gov/programs/Permits/AirManagementPermits/Pages/index.aspx (click on Docket Number 11-23). Any applicant-provided information regarding a description of the environmental and socioeconomic indicators contributing to that EJ score can also be found at the listed website. Such information has not yet been reviewed by the Department.A review of the submitted information will be conducted when the Department undertakes its technical review of all documents included in the application.Pursuant to the Environment Article, Section 1-603, Annotated Code of Maryland, an Informational Meeting has been scheduled so that citizens can discuss the application and the permit review process with the applicant and the Department.A community informational meeting has been scheduled so that citizens can discuss the application and the permit with the applicant and the Department. The community informational meeting will be held virtually on November 28, 2023 at 6:30 p.m.To attend the meeting, please register using the following link no later than November 27, 2023: https://forms.gle/9xtRc2Bx4No3k27h7 Registered attendees will receive instructions on how to join the virtual meeting using a computer and internet connection or telephone.The Department will provide an interpreter for deaf and hearing impaired persons provided that a request is made for such service at least ten (10) days prior to the meeting. Further information may be obtained by calling Ms. Shannon Heafey at 410-537-4433.Christopher R. Hoagland, Director Air and Radiation Administration 3039701 TR 11/15,11/22/2023TARA K. Property Section 14-840 The object of this proceeding is to secure the foreclosure of all rights of redemption in the following property sold by the Director of Finance and Collector of Taxes for the State of Maryland and Caroline County to the Plaintiff in this proceeding: The property BEING IN THE FIFTH ELECTION DISTRICT AND IS DESCRIBED AS 6,320 SF SW/S BROWN ROAD W OF FEDERALSBURG ACCOUNT NUMBER 05-015456, IN CAROLINE COUNTY, MARYLAND, The Complaint states, among other things, that the amounts necessary for redemption have not been paid and requests the Court to pass a Final Judgment providing that the Director of Finance and Collector of Taxes for Caroline County, Maryland execute a deed to the property herein vesting in the Plaintiff a good and marketable, indefeasible and absolute, free and clear of any and all liens, claims, and encumbrances, foreclosing all rights of redemption of the Defendants and any other person(s), firms, and corporations or other entities, having any interest in the property.It is thereupon this 6th day of November, 2023, by the Circuit Court for Caroline County, ORDERED, that notice be given by the insertion of a copy of this Order in some newspaper having a general circulation in Caroline County once a week for three successive weeks and the last insertion on or before December 7, 2023, warning all persons interested in the property to appear in this Court by the 8th day of January, 2024, and redeem the property described herein, and answer the Complaint, or thereafter, a FINAL JUDGMENT will be entered FORECLOSING ALL RIGHTS of redemption in the property, vesting in the plaintiff a title, free and clear of all encumbrances.FAILURE TO ANSWER OR REDEEM THIS PROPERTY WITHIN THE TIME ALLOWED ABOVE MAY RESULT IN A JUDGMENT FORECLOSING THE RIGHT OF REDEMPTION.Heather Price Judge/Clerk 3039510 TR 11/15,11/22,11/29/2023Samuel I. Washington St., Suite 14 Easton, MD 21601 3039461 SD 11/15,11/22,11/29/202Final Notice and Public Explanation of a Proposed Activity in a Wetland To: All interested Agencies, Groups and Individuals This is to give notice that HUD, under 24 CFR Part 50, has conducted an evaluation as required by Executive Order 11990, in accordance with HUD regulations at 24 CFR 55.20 Subpart C Procedures for Making Determinations on Floodplain Management and Protection of Wetlands, to determine the potential affect that its activity in the wetland will have on the human environment.The project is under a Community Planning and Development - Community Project Funding grant and the proposed activity consists of constructing a 24,000 square-foot community space which will provide greater access to services and resources and create opportunities for people to live, work, and connect throughout the community. The project is located at 480 Port Street in Easton, Maryland, southeast of the intersection of Port Street and Meadow Drive. The project aims to serve a need for the community and the proposed structure will include a community hub, behavioral health suite, office and training spaces, and affordable housing to those most vulnerable to rising living costs in Maryland.Approximately 4,899.4 square feet (sf) of the wetland will be impacted by the construction of the new facility and associated parking area. Activities impacting the wetland include excavation, removal of vegetation, filling, and grading. The project was designed to leave pockets of wetlands undisturbed on-site.HUD has considered the following alternatives and mitigation measures to be taken to minimize adverse impacts and to restore and preserve natural and beneficial values: Three alternatives were investigated including two alternative sites and the "no action" alternative. The subject property was chosen because the area is part of the Port Street Redevelopment Plan and is in proximity to downtown Easton, the waterfront area, and has access to recreation areas such as the rail trail and nearby parks.Permits for this work include a Nontidal Wetlands and Waterways permit from the Maryland Department of the Environment (MDE) as well as a Maryland State Programmatic General Permit-6 (MDSPGP-6) from the United States Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), Authorization Number: 22-NT-2038/202260713. The MDSPGP-6 permit allows for the construction of the new building, associated parking areas, stormwater management, and other features. The project will be designed and permitted to comply with all federal, state, and local codes and regulations.HUD has reevaluated the alternatives to building in the wetland and has determined that it has no practicable alternative. Environmental files that document compliance with steps 3 through 6 of Executive Order 11990, are available for public inspection, review and copying upon request at the times and location delineated in the last paragraph of this notice for receipt of comments.There are three primary purposes for this notice. First, people who may be affected by activities in wetlands and those who have an interest in the protection of the natural environment should be given an opportunity to express their concerns and provide information about these areas. Second, an adequate public notice program can be an important public educational tool. The dissemination of information about wetlands can facilitate and enhance Federal efforts to reduce the risks associated with the occupancy and modification of these special areas. Third, as a matter of fairness, when the Federal government determines it will participate in actions taking place in a wetland, it must inform those who may be put at greater or continued risk.Written comments must be received by HUD no later than November 29, 2023. They should be addressed to Mr. Kerry Johnson, Field Environmental Officer, U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development, Region III, 600 E. Broad Street, Richmond, VA 23219-1800, (800) 842-2610 ext. 4803 or (804) 822-4803. Comments may also be submitted via email at kerry. johnson@hud.gov.Date: November 22, 2023 3040112 SD 11/22/2023JoRhea N. Claims filed after that date or after a date extended by law will be barred.AMY WOERNER, Foreign Personal Representatives Name of newspaper designated by Personal Representative: THE STAR DEMOCRAT Date of publication: NOVEMBER 15, 2023 True Test Copy Patricia E. Campen, Register of Wills for Talbot County, Courthouse - North Wing 11 N. Washington Street, Suite 14, Easton, MD 21601 3039506 SD 11/15,11/22,11/29/2023SMALL ESTATE NOTICE OF APPOINTMENT NOTICE TO CREDITORS NOTICE TO UNKNOWN HEIRS Estate No. 24840 TO ALL PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE ESTATE OF CATHERINE MARIE COLEY Notice is given that MARY ANN STRINGFELLOW, 10070 OLD STILLHOUSE ROAD, BOSTON, VA 22713 was on NOVEMBER 14, 2023 appointed personal representative of the small estate of CATHERINE MARIE COLEY who died on NOVEMBER 7, 2023 with a will.Further information can be obtained by reviewing the estate file in the office of the Register of Wills or by contacting the personal representative or the attorney.All persons having any objection to the appointment shall file their objections with the Register of Wills within 30 days after the date of publication of this Notice. All persons having an objection to the probate of the will shall file their objections with the Register of Wills within six months after the date of publication of this Notice.All persons having claims against the decedent must serve their claims on the undersigned personal representative or file them with the Register of Wills with a copy to the undersigned on or before the earlier of the following dates: (1) Six months from the date of the decedent's death; or (2) Thirty days after the personal representative mails or otherwise delivers to the creditor a copy of this published notice or other written notice, notifying the creditor that the claims will be barred unless the creditor presents the claim within thirty days from the mailing or other delivery of the notice. Any claim not served or filed within that time, or any extension provided by law, is unenforceable thereafter.MARY ANN STRINGFELLOW, PERSONAL REPRESENTATIVE Name of newspaper designated by personal representative: THE STAR DEMOCRAT Date of Publication: NOVEMBER 22, 2023 TRUE TEST COPY Patricia E. Campen Register of Wills for Talbot County Courthouse - North Wing 11 N. Washington Street, Suite 14 Easton, MD 21601 3039856 SD 11/22/2023

llm_classification.explanation: The article consists entirely of legal and public notices related to property sales, estate proceedings, court rulings, and regulatory announcements. While some content touches on local government activities, the primary classification aligns with 'Public Notices' as the dominant theme.

title: Legal Notices
content:

DOUGLAS A RIDDLEBERGER, et al, Defendants.NOTICE Notice is hereby issued this 17th day of November, 2023, that the sale of the property in this case, 25899 BROOKWOOD ROAD, GREENSBORO MD 21639, reported by Jennifer Deardorff, Attorney for the Substitute Trustee, be ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary be shown on or before the 18th day of December, 2023, provided a copy of this Notice be inserted in Times Record, a newspaper published in CAROLINE County, Maryland, once in each of three (3) successive weeks on or before the 11th day of December, 2023.The report states the amount of sale to be $231,073.25.Terry B. Lord Clerk 3040406 TR 11/22,11/29,12/6/2023 PUBLIC NOTICES Call 410-770-4080 or 1-877-659-2190 EMAIL LEGALS@CHESPUB.COM TOWN OF DENTON NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING The Denton Town Council will conduct a Public Hearing on December 11, 2023, at 6:00 p.m., on the following Resolution and Ordinance: Resolution #896 - A Resolution of the Town of Denton to adopt the Town of Denton 2020 Comprehensive Plan.Ordinance #750 - An Ordinance to amend the Denton Town Code Zoning Ordinance and provisions contained in Chapter 128 of the Denton Town Code with respect to multifamily housing and apartments.A complete copy of the Resolution and Ordinance along with information on how to access the meeting is available on the Town of Denton website at www.dentonmaryland.com. and at the Denton Town Office during normal business hours. The Public Hearing will take place at the Denton Town Hall, 4 N. Second St., Denton, Maryland.By Authority: Denton Town Council 3040105 TR 11/22,11/29/2023 WALTER B. PALMER, III ESQ.108 MARKET ST.DENTON, MD 21629 NOTICE OF APPOINTMENT NOTICE TO CREDITORS NOTICE TO UNKNOWN HEIRS Estate No. 11200 TO ALL PERSONS INTERESTED IN THE ESTATE OF ALVIN J. CIPRICH Notice is given that: JEFFERY H. CIPRICH, 10813 GREENSBORO RD, DENTON, MD 21629 was on NOVEMBER 21, 2023 appointed Personal Representative of the estate of: ALVIN J. CIPRICH who died on OCTOBER 24, 2023 without a will.Further information can be obtained by reviewing the estate file in the office of the Register of Wills or by contacting the personal representative or the attorney.All persons having any objection to the appointment (or to the probate of the decedent's will) shall file their objections with the Register of Wills on or before the 21ST day of MAY, 2024 (6 months from date of appointment).Any person having a claim against the decedent must present the claim to the undersigned personal representative or file it with the Register of Wills with a copy to the undersigned on or before the earlier of the following dates: (1) Six months from the date of the decedent's death; or (2) Two months after the personal representative mail or otherwise delivers to the creditor a copy of this published notice or other written notice, notifying the creditor that the claim will be barred unless the creditor presents the claims within two months from the mailing or other delivery of the notice. A claim not presented or filed on or before that date, or any extension provided by law, is unenforceable thereafter. Claim forms may be obtained from the Register of Wills.JEFFERY H. JONES, et al, Defendants.NOTICE Notice is hereby issued this 17th day of November, 2023, that the sale of the property in this case, 22152 HILLSBORO RD DENTON MD 21629, reported by Jennifer Deardorff, Attorney for the Substitute Trustee, be ratified and confirmed, unless cause to the contrary be shown on or before the 18th day of December, 2023, provided a copy of this Notice be inserted in Times Record, a newspaper published in CAROLINE County, Maryland, once in each of three (3) successive weeks on or before the 11th day of December, 2023.The report states the amount of sale to be $181,871.43.Terry B. A claim not presented or filed on or before that date, or any extension provided by law, is unenforceable thereafter. Claim forms may be obtained from the Register of Wills.AMOS ALLEN CRAWFORD, PERSONAL REPRESENTATIVE Name of newspaper designated by personal representative: TIMES RECORD Date of publication: NOVEMBER 22, 2023 TRUE TEST COPY James L.
